review:
I put tons of hours into Super Monday Night Combat which was the sequel to this game that came out a year later and vanished completely from Steam due to EU GDPR in 2018.  I have no idea how MNC didn't vanish either.  

The game was amazingly good fun and shits all over Overwatch and Overwatch 2.  It will be missed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998543056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 616, 'playtime_forever': 679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 1649635869}
review:
[b] >Be me, 2010.

>Heard about Monday Night Combat, a game that's part MOBA, part third-person shooter, and part "What-the-heck-am-I-playing." 🎮🤔

>Jump into the game, greeted by a mix of wonderfully designed character including some extremely hot ladies, always a boner I mean bonus!

>Decide to play as the Assassin, because who doesn't want to be a cloaked ninja with a freaking crossbow, right? 🗡️🕶️

>Game starts, and suddenly I'm in this crazy arena where the goal is to destroy each other's Moneyball. Yeah, a freaking Moneyball. Not kidding. 💰🏀
>Going all out, jumping, shooting, and getting wrecked by a hyperactive Support class with an infinite supply of healing drones. How is this fair, devs?! 😅

>Suddenly, a Blitz mode where hordes of robots come at you. And you gotta defend the Moneyball. It's like tower defense on steroids. And maybe some Red Bull too. 🤖🏰

>Teamwork is key, but also throwing your teammates under the bus when things go south. Hey, it's Monday Night Combat, not Friendship Night Combat, right? 🚌🤝

>Oh, did I mention the announcer? This dude's voice is the perfect mix of hype and sarcasm. He's like the hyperactive sports commentator that never sleeps. And you can't help but love him. 🎤😄

>And then, there was the sequel, Super Monday Night Combat. It was like Monday Night Combat on acid, with more characters, more absurdity, and more "What in the world am I playing?" 🌀🌈🚀

>But now, the sad part. Monday Night Combat and its sequel are like forgotten relics lost in the gaming abyss. The servers are as empty as my wallet after a Steam sale. RIP the good old days. 😢💻

>But hey, if you ever find a dusty old copy, or if some magical time-traveling game genie brings it back, give it a shot. It's like stepping into a time capsule of chaotic, absurd, and strangely addictive gameplay. Monday Night Combat, you were a wild ride. Farewell, old friend. 👋🕰️🎮 [/b]

[b] Scene: Deep in the heart of the jungle, George, his faithful companion Ape, the lovely Ursula, and their friend Tookie the Toucan have set up a makeshift gaming console. They're all gathered around, ready to dive into a game of Monday Night Combat. George, with his lovable but sometimes clueless demeanor, is about to start the game.

George: (Excited) "Okay, friends! George have something called 'Monday Night Combat'! It's like smashing things in the jungle, but on the tiny screen! 🎮"

Ape: (Intellectual, with a British accent) "Ah, 'Monday Night Combat.' How intriguing. It appears to be a digital simulation of adversarial competition. Quite the modern pastime. 🤓"

Ursula: (Adventurous) "I'm in, George! Let's see what this Monday Night Combat is all about. 💪"

Tookie: (Squawking) "Tookie wants to play too! Tookie's ready for action! 🦜"

George: (Eager) "Great! George press the start button... Now, we're fighting other people in the future, or something like that! 🚀"

Ape: (Analyzing) "It seems we are engaging in a futuristic conflict. How fascinating. These weapons appear to be particularly advanced. 🔍"

Ursula: (Fighting) "We'll have to work together and strategize to win, I suppose. 🤺"

Tookie: (Excited) "Tookie's gonna choose the colorful character with the big hat! Look at me, I'm a star! 🌟"

George: (Puzzled) "Why are these people shooting us with shiny balls? George thought we're supposed to be friends. 😕"

Ape: (Chuckles) "George, it's a game! You're meant to oppose each other in friendly competition. 😄"

Ursula: (Competitive) "Get ready, everyone! We're in for some action! 🏁"

Tookie: (Squawking) "Tookie's shooting colorful balls at the enemy! Take that! 💥"

George: (Laughing) "This is fun! George feels like a tree-swinging hero! 🌲"

Ape: (Focused) "Ah, power-ups. They should provide a tactical advantage. I'll make good use of them. 💡"

Ursula: (Commanding) "Stay together, team! We've got this! 🙌"

Tookie: (Cheering) "Tookie got a double knockout! We're on fire! 🔥"

George: (Excited) "Watch out, other team! George is a jungle combat master! 🤩"

Ape: (Proud) "Well played, team. Our combined efforts have yielded success. 👏"

Ursula: (Grinning) "That was surprisingly fun, George! 😁"

Tookie: (Celebrating) "Tookie's a gaming champion! Who knew? 🎉"

George: (Excited) "Monday Night Combat was the best game ever! Now, who's up for some swinging through trees? 🌴"

Ape: (Intellectual) "Ah, George, as captivating as your proposal may be, I must return to my literary pursuits. A fine gaming experience, indeed. 📚" [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197969587017', 'num_games_owned': 1378, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1655356860}
review:
I remember really liking this game on both the Xbox 360 Arcade and PC for LAN parties.
Specifically, we played the co-op wave survival game quite a bit. It has different classes, and you earn money from kills and buy upgrades for your kit and base defense nodes. While it doesn't have the depth or charm of Team Fortress 2, which I would say had to have been one of its inspirations at the time, it's a good game with friends.

It will launch on Steam Deck, but even though most of the game recognizes the gamepad and even shows gamepad buttons, some interactables still show the keyboard mapping icons and refuse to allow the gamepad to do anything with it at all with them. Trying to interact with the main menus using the touch screen mostly works for the larger items, but the small drop down menus don't seem to be very accurate with your finger. I haven't fought with it very hard, and I'm sure with some careful configurations these issues could be bypassed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047891833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1650152704}
review:
As the rest of the reviews say, this is basically a dead game.  I used to play this on Xbox.  If you look around on the interwebz, there is a discord group that still plays on a semi-regular basis.  The old MNC forums still get a post from time to time.  This was one of my favorite games growing up and I think it's still worth a buy as long as there's even a still very small group of players playing.

If you want to know what happened to the game, the TL;DR is that none of UberEntertainment's games really panned out.  They lost a bunch of money and eventually closed their doors.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999469319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2833, 'last_played': 1358150400}
review:
One of the best new game idea's I've played EVEN when it was 10+years ago.
Fun game modes, Fun characters and great strategies.
The game itself reminded me to Team Fortress2.
It was save to say one of the most games to play between others.
Don't understand why it died quickly,  not many bugs or hackers were found back then.
Games were fast and quite balanced.
Would have been better to be released in this era.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039392830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
Monday Night Combat foi um dos jogos mais divertidos que pude experimentar enquanto ainda dava meus primeiros passos na Steam. Foi também o meu primeiro contato com um jogo multiplayer competitivo aqui na plataforma. 

Considerado por alguns como um clone de Team Fortress 2, em minha humilde opinião, MNC se sai muito melhor em diversos aspectos, começando pelas mecânicas diferenciadas e bastante divertidas, especialmente à época de seu lançamento. 

Desafortunadamente, por um descuido dos desenvolvedores, este jogo foi abandonado à própria sorte por uma sequência Free-to-Play que não chegou nem aos pés do original, o que acabou prejudicando ambos os jogos, que viram a base de jogadores diminuir dia após dia, sendo que hoje é praticamente impossível encontrar sequer uma partida online que não seja combinada entre amigos.

10/10. Descanse em paz MNC.

review: It's the anti-TF2 and the spiritual successor to SmashTV, if anyone is ancient enough to remember that NES gem, with Thunderball starring L.L. Cool J..  It could be argued this game is having too much fun, but loosen up ya mope. This game never really got its due. And people sat around waiting for mega corps to remake bloatware like Overwatch, idiots. $5 is very reasonable, for what you get, But its the current year, give it away now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002854360', 'num_games_owned': 449, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 3788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3770, 'last_played': 1630754129}
review:
Legendary game that was so ahead of its time it wasn't even funny.  Sadly its successor, Super MNC/SMNC, has been gone from Steam since 2018.  Unlikely to get any games on this outside of organized get-togethers.  Still, was such an addicting game to play back in its heyday, and they gave it so many free updates before moving on to make SMNC.  

Real shame that we're unlikely to ever see another go with the Monday Night Combat IP, because it was such a fun time and the atmosphere got you hyped up like crazy at the start of every match.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066877294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1612580772}
review:
This game was pretty much my TF2. I sank so many hours into this game every day when I'd get home from High School and hop on my 360. I still think about how much I love this game ten years later. This game captures the strategy of Tower Defense style games with the unique combination of a class based shooter with the intensity of a great MOBA all combined into an extremely well put together game that's fun for a quick match or to play all day. Monday Night Combat shines in so many ways I couldn't possibly list all of them, but I'd still like to illustrate why this is one of the best online multiplayer games ever made, period.

The combination of Tower Defense, class based shooter and moba makes this game go beyond a lot of issues that these genres of games have on their own. With a good strategy you alone or your team can sneak straight through the lane into their base and quickly win, which in tower defense games normally you just are stuck with an insane amount of enemies that you can't really outsmart which becomes very boring. Also building defenses and different turrets can help fight the enemy teams strategy as well, which makes building turrets thought provoking but you don't have to devote yourself to that aspect either. The classes are very well made and there is no definitively better class (But a team of gunners really sucks to play against) and each plays uniquely and meshes well with others which I think a lot of games (tf2 included) don't do very well. Even if there is someone that just destroys with their class as long as you make sure they don't get bots to push you can still easily win despite the frustratingly good player, which is nice because in a lot of shooters tryhards can ruin a fun game and carry. This doesn't mean that the combat is lacking at all, characters all have small nuances like the snipers grapple that at full upgrades launches people a mile away and often knocks off the map which is an AMAZING feeling when someone rushes you. And lastly on the subject of unique abilities the MOBA qualities here are mostly just the skills you purchase in the match with the currency you get in match and the intensity of pushing bots through the two lanes. Despite the sound, this never felt like the never ending pushing and defending most MOBA's like LoL have. This game encourages you to take different approaches and most levels have multiple ways of reaching an area to flank or even come up behind enemies who are camping and defending. And if you never want to defend, invest all your money in the best turrets and you can focus on a straight  on assault. This game lets you play in so many different ways that you will come up with absolutely silly strategies. Resource management becomes an important factor when they are in your base and you are struggling to keep your last two turrets up and the intensity is at its peak at your desperate last stand. 

Even beyond this weird mashup of genres that works beautifully there are other unique gameplay features like Bullseye the mascot you literally kill for juice and money which becomes an intense king of the hill match in its own and can be game changing, JUICING which just puts you in godmode for about ten seconds which is also a game changer, and the annihilator which destroys all enemy bots and slightly damages everyone for a price. You can also buy unique bots that can kill enemy players and help you get down a lane and attack the enemy base. All these little quirks let you play in a way that is unique to you but also allows you to greatly change your strategy mid game if nothing else is working.

All these things make this game zany, wild and unpredictable. Nothing feels unfair or broken, matches can be extremely quick or about ten minutes with a sudden death of all out attacking each others base. The maps are incredibly designed and fun to play except spunky cola stage. This game will really doesn't feel like it has aged either to me. The gameplay is so tight and the concept is so fun its just timeless. Really a Masterpiece.

review:
Пиратка: чуваак, зацени как я хороша
 Я *откатав парчу часов*: да, и впрямь выглядит задорно, по локалочке с друзьями покатать самое то. Ещё и русский язык есть, вообще отлично. Поддержу-ка разработчиков, купив игру  в стиме
 Лицензия: helloy
 Я: привет-привет, как тут язык на русский поменять?
 Лицензия: даз ист фантастиш технолоджи, я в такое не умею.
 Я: чтооо? А какого хрена пиратка умеет? Может как-то можно файлик перенести или что-то в этом роде?
 Лицензия: и это тоже даз ист...
Я: поддержал **** разработчиков @@@@!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198170077799', 'num_games_owned': 380, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1612832263}
review:
[u]Pros[/u]
[list]
[*] Timeless cartoon graphics (could use an upscaling but still looks fresh)
[*] Great class based team shooter/tower-defense/MOBA
[*] Great writing and world building, funny as hell
[/list]

[u]Cons[/u]
[list]
[*] Might not attract new players other than those who enjoyed it at its peak
[*] Dead game unless you join the fan made Discord server
[/list]

[u]Overall[/u]
Great game, would recommend for the 5$ price tag although the online is pretty dead so you're mostly left with a single-player survival mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198339697991', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1674274011}
review:
Back around 2011-2012, I played this game with my dad on the Xbox. I bought it a few months ago here for half a dollar. I wish this game was still alive and well. I never knew this game had a sequel (which i now technically own 4 copies for) and I'm sad that its never coming back because the company behind this got dissolved. some of the staff is now working on Kerbal Space Program 2. Maybe if i could get into contact with any former employees...

Anyway, this game is great. buy it when its on sale though, because barely anyone is playing it currently.

[/quote]

[h1] ▀▄▀▄▀▄ Monday Night Combat ▄▀▄▀▄▀ [/h1]

[u][b]TL,DR Review[/b][/u]

While many of us will miss the now shutdown Super Monday Night Combat, the original MNC lives on with a small but dedicated player base. Fun for returning players, a harder sell for new players who might be interested.

[u][b]Full Review[/b][/u]

Well it's only been 5 years since I last played, why not jump back in?

Monday Night Combat is a 6v6 or co-op class based shooter that came out originally on the Xbox 360 and eventually Steam when Flash Sales were still around and Steam Events were still cool. You have 6 classes available: Assault, Gunner, Assassin, Support, Tank & Sniper. They are pretty much exactly as they sound, with 3 available skills that can be upgraded as you collect money from destroyed bots and kills. They don't have much of a personality as characters but this was created as a $15 game. The goal is to defend your money ball while attacking the other teams money ball. You can also activate jump-pads, send additional waves of bots or even save your money for the annihilator. Don't forget to collect those juiceboxes and juice up, equating to an overdrive on your damage and rate of fire for a limited time.

The presentation is still great with an over-the-top major sports league\gameshow theme. You'll have the occasional mascot to empty your ammo clips on to get money & ammo, a manic-like announcer, & of course the Pit Girl. Map design also follow suit with a future-sports style and there is a decent amount of map variety to experience.

Player count is.....surprisingly high for a 10 year old game. It seems like you can find enough players to join on the weekends and a fair amount still on Steam Discussions to add and start a few matches with. I managed to play a few matches and as you would expect, get pretty much steam-rolled by players who are all at the highest level count. The option for running your own dedicated servers or LAN play probably helps, no P2P connections here.

I'd say at $5, it still might be worth picking up if you have a few friends who are interested in jumping back in. However, when the likes of Overwatch and Paladins are available, I'm not sure what kind of appeal there is beyond nostalgia. Sadly, the vastly superior Super Monday Night Combat has been shutdown for over a year when GDRP compliance came around and was really a ton of fun. Monday Night Combat is fun to revisit every few years to see those 2011 Steam Summer prizes that you unlocked and fill Chickey Cantor with lead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025630223', 'num_games_owned': 3289, 'num_reviews': 297, 'playtime_forever': 2133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2133, 'last_played': 1579119333}
review:
A really fun, but unfortunately "living dead" game.  This is a great early Hero Shooter with some Tower Defense elements, that I feel may have been kneecapped by it's quickly-released, much worse sequel 'Super Monday Night Combat'(which also completely changed the gameplay to that of a MOBA).  It's a true shame because 'Monday Night Combat' has decent visuals, a great sense of humor, and some genuinely fun game modes.  

But, as I mentioned, it's essentially been a "living dead" game since it's release on Steam as it's only ever had an all-time player peak of 51.  As of this review the peak is 16.  Good game, but it was sadly born dead on Steam.  If you have a bunch of a friends to play with, I say organize together and pick it up if it goes on sale—otherwise you're wasting money.

[h1]7/10 - With Friends | 2/10 - Solo Play[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198053527635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 892, 'last_played': 1576301260}
review:
Ah, Monday Night Combat. a game from the heydays of when TF2 wasn't even F2P. If you ever see this game on sale, and try seeing if you can get some people to grab it. You've got a Coop shooter mode vs waves of Minion- Er... Bots, which you can also play solo, albeit slightly harder, and then you've got the meat and potatoes, the VS mode.

 The name of the game is to be as sporty as possible. Taunt after kills, Taunt after takedowns, Taunt after counters, Taunt after Taunts. Oh, and go smash a globe full of money. You get six unique classes, each comes with two weapons, three abilities, and four upgrades. Each one of these classes specializes in Something or other, with the assault being a 'play-maker', the Support doing his namesake, the Tank actually being a very terrifying class in close range, so on. Their playstyles are very straightforward, despite what it seems.

Maps are super easy to understand once you've gone through them once or twice. there's a lane of robots which you want to push to the enemy's globe, however, the enemy wants to do the same, all the while there's a second level that only players can get to, that is full of people shooting at each other. When the game was alive and well, you had constant combat and fighting for days at a time.

Now, the game's dead. I'm not sure who let it die, frankly, but as a "Non-Couch Party Shooter / Fancy Moba-Esque but Not Quite" game, it's amazing. And mainly because the "MOBA" gameplay in it is basically just pushing the robots and making money. That's it.

If enough people ever pick this game back up, and somehow manage to revive it, someone let me know.


TL;DR, Game's fun, but it's very unfortunately, very dead. Full of a large amount of Comedy and Action, if you're looking for a shooter to spend maybe, 10 hours (nudge nudge) just by yourself, this is it. If you've got friends, with money, or Friends and you have money, send a couple copies their way and get everyone in on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000102436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1465, 'last_played': 1616967920}
review:
One of my favourite games- we played it for hours at the local gaming cafe when it originally came out and have sporadically gone back to it since. A weird cross of Team Fortress and DOTA, with a background announcer out of You Don't Know Jack.

Its a great game if there are 4, 6 or 8 of you wanting a bit of a laugh for a couple of hours every so often. 6 classes to play, different abilities to tweak if you want to and it can be quite tricky perfecting some of the shots you need to land. Team members juggle about every round and you can get quite different games with changing up a couple of players classes on a different map.

Negative is that you won't find randoms playing this very often, and if you do they are insanely good. So find some friends or play the vs bot game.

Also shooting the power up mascot always feels stupidly fun.

review:
I'm sure in its hayday it was a great game to play with friends, but now that it's dead and gone it's an achievement hunter's worst nightmare.  Hundreds of hours of pure, active grind to complete this game.  No mods, no edits, no cheese, there's nothing you can do to get around this game's insane amount of active time needed to slowly grind for achievements.

I swear I will finish this one day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198347447937', 'num_games_owned': 369, 'num_reviews': 274, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1562554396}
review:
I randomly found this game while browsing the Steam Summer sale for 90% off. I was skeptical at first so I went on YouTube to find a game play video or something and low and behold, AngryJoe did a review on it. After seeing that he gave it a great review, I decided to buy it.

The first time I played for 20 minutes, I thought I regretted my purchase. After just playing for another 30 minutes, boy was I wrong. This may have been one of the best games I've ever gotten for fifty cents. It's worth the full $5.00 imo and that's before I've even hit my first hour in the game and not having even played the MP part of it yet.

I went in knowing the MP was dead but I totally wish I just had a few other people to play this with because there are two servers right there waiting to be filled. The single player mode is still fun as hell. I did get the game to run in 1440p and I love that the fps is already at a locked 144 right when you install and run the game. It plays like a combination of multiple games wrapped into one. Team Fortress 2, Paladins and Plants Vs Zombies to name a few. 

If you're wondering whether or not to buy this game, I say don't even hesitate. Especially if it's at a sale price and you have a few friends to get the full benefit out of it. Like I said, I personally am enjoying it solo. The devs really put some thought into the single player.

HIGHLY recommend this game. You will not regret your purchase. In fact, I just noticed you can get the four pack(4 copies of the game) for $1.49 TOTAL. That's perfect if you have 3 other friends that are into this type of game. If I did, I'd easily buy that pack right now and give some friends the perfect early Christmas present.

author: {'steamid': '76561198246365978', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1565122147}
review:
Прошу вас, не поленитесь и прочтите! Тут будет про закрытие SMNC, почему его именно закрыли (1), мой обзор и про игру (2) и в конце идея для комьюнити игры (3). Я разрешил коментарии, можете дописывать то, что я не сказал или ещё что-то.
    (1) Условно-бесплатная MOBA Super Monday Night Combat прекратит своё существование в следующем месяце из-за новых законов о конфиденциальности ЕС. Что бы избежать штрафов, разработчикам пришлось закрыть SMNC, а на её переделывание уйдёт значительно больше денег, чем было потрачено на создание проекта и поскольку сервера давно не набивались битком они удалили её а оставили часть от этой игры. 
    (2) Игра классная, и вот TF я тут практически не вижу. Классы? - да есть сходство. Цвета команд? - да ну, в большой куче игр всегда красные против синих, но на месте разработчиков я бы задумался добавить больше цветов команд, поскольку в игре с такой тематикой это будет хорошо смотреться, а не так как в TF. Сначала я зашёл в игру только ради шапки, но потом я осознал насколько эта игра хороша, потом когда я её захотел установить вновь, её не оказалось, потом наткнулся на то что написал выше и очень сильно расстроился, но вот наткнулся  на скажем так огрызок от той игры и не задумываясь купил! В игре осталось всего 6 персонажей: ассасин, танк, пулемётчик, снайпер, солдат и механик-хиллер. 2 режима игры, в одном вам нужно сражаться с другими игроками и сопроводить роботов к денежному шару, в защите вам помогут турели, их 4 вида: пулемёт, мортира, ракетница и вроде замедлялка, каждую турель можно улучшить несколько раз. В игре есть также спонсоры, которые дают разные бафы. А второй режим это защита денежного шара, 4 игрока будут отбиваться от волн роботов, в защите так же помогут турели. Так же присутствует прокачка, прокачать можно 4 параметра например ловкость броня и т.д. Жаль только что нету русской локализации, но этот минус сущий пустяк! 
    (3) Ребят, если вам нравится эта игра, то заходите в группу (нас там всего 6 человек) и начинайте играть вместе! А то захожу, а онлайн 0! Да это не SMNC, да тут всего лишь частичка от той игры, но если мы - комьюнити, будем поддерживать онлайн, есть шанс что разработчики вернутся и начнут развивать эту игру, это зависит от нас и только от нас! Я вас очень прошу, не дайте пропасть этой игре!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11093, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 26, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1709700952}
review:
Monday Night Combat is an unusual hybrid of PvE third person arena shooter combined with an "Orcs Must Die" tower defense/survival mechanic.   While a good idea, there's some problems here, this game has aged much more quickly than a game from 2010 should have.

There's no support for 4K or even 1440p resolutions.  The online modes have been switched off by the devs, so there's not really any online play anymore, it's just PvE vs bots, in which case Orcs Must Die is a better game outright.  The graphics aren't great because this is a console port (although the controls and graphics customisation aren't terrible). 

Sadly, the heyday for this game is over.  I can't recommend anyone buys this today.

author: {'steamid': '76561198181872359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1514559215}
review: horrible, una de las peores compras que hice en mi vida, aun que solo me haya costado 16 ARS, un juego muy aburrido y las animaciones mas el ambiente hacen que te den ganas de volver a juegosdiaros.com

author: {'steamid': '76561198047272264', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 4303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1712, 'last_played': 1669495247}
review:
A great MOBA-like 3rd Person Shooter. If you have the patience to master it, it's very rewarding. The regular playerbase consists of about 20-odd people with about 10-12 on at least 3-4 times per week in a single server. There are 3 servers up and running and, some days, 2 of those are almost full.

For the few dollars it costs, it's definitely worth a go, though be prepared to die a lot early on and practice to get better, most of us still playing have been playing for years. But fire away any questions and you'll find the community is a great one; very friendly.

Oh, and games usually run at least a couple times a week from about 6am until 12pm AEDT (Australian Eastern Daylight Time, GMT 11+) or about 11am until 5pm PST (Pacific Standard Time, GMT -8) or 7pm until 1am GMT (Greenwich Mean Time).

Cheers all, hope to see you on the battlefield!

author: {'steamid': '76561198280369209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1682393214}
review:
Best thing ever created. 

Mondays used to be the worst days of the week. It is a known fact for everyone, mondays suck. The weekend is over and you gotta go back to school or work or whatever. I hated mondays more than the average person and petitioned to get them removed from the calendar on several occassions. One day a pal said to me "Hey if you hate mondays so much, just find something to do on mondays." So I tried. Monday Night Football was the best solution but still, it was usually a boring game and mondays still sucked. Then one day I was browsing through the steam store on the low priced games (I ain't rich) during a sale. I stumbled upon this game and thought "EW... why would a game have Monday in the title??" Then I did some research on the 82 cent (on sale) game and saw it was actually really cool. Then it hit me... could this "Combat" be what I need to save mondays? Oh boy was I right x10000. First of all for an older game, the graphics are AMAZING. I've played some of the best looking games to date and this is up there. However, it is not all about the graphics. The combat in this game is simply INCREDIBLE. I've had more fun playing this game than doing ANYTHING else. You can even play this awesome game with your friends! The possibilites are endless. This game is smooth, looks nice and is REALLY fun. It has everything a game needs and its only 82cents (on sale). This game has turned mondays into the BEST day of the week. I now have a different view on monday. It is a misunderstood day of the week. The game really makes you feel like monday, which ironically is amazing. Now I count the SECONDS until the next monday, so that I can play this game again. 10/10, BUY NOW!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993944138', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1590087904}
review: The "OG" game. I think it's better than the free variant just due to it having a more developed single player, which is the only thing you can play nowadays. There is no multiplayer. Matchmaking requires a lobby of 8 members and the highest I was ever in had 4. It won't start until full and I waited almost 2 hours for the lobby to fill. No dice. The problem is I can't really reccomend it because I only found it fun when I was in multiplayer, back when people played this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138781453', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1605122575}
review: Got this classic gem for 74 cents during a sale. Despite the very low player count there is ocassionaly one semi-full lobby during peak hours. That one lobby makes this game all the more fun. Graphics have not aged poorly at all. Wouldn't buy it for full price though, put this game on your wishlist and wait for a sale! You also get 4 copies of Super Monday Night Combat (Shutdown earlier this year) and a 3-day trial for Monday Night Combat when you purchase the base game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048924830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1454306038}
review:
Non.

juste non...

j'ai ce jeu depuis longtemp, je n'y ai que tres peu jouer. ( j'ai meme encore un "cadeau" steam dans mon inventaire pour "super monday night" ( on y viendra plus tard) que j'ai obtenu avec le pack )

a l'époque deja, ce jeu ne m'attirai pas beaucoup. Fun 10 minutes , puis franchement barbant ( comme les barbares).
le multi etait pété a l'extreme, aucun équilibrage. était, car tout est mort aujourdhui.
le solo ? ah ben parlons s'en tien... le solo est encore plus barbant que des barbares barbotant barbants.
je voi des éval qui parle de "bots" ... j'ai rater quelque chose ?
parce qu'il n'y a pas de bots içi, on joue solo, seul sur la piste a tuer les vague ennemis ( qui bien évidement finiront par vous tuer en difficile, ou seront franchement ennuyeux en mode facile ), y a pas de bots allié ou ennemi. on est 100% solo.
on tue des ennemis et on construit des tours pour défendre sa base ( yup, tower defense le truc, seul mode de jeu dispo solo)
 en gros, je récapitule le systeme pourav des devs..

sorti de monday night combat > 
payant... > 
peu de succes... > 
sorti de "super" monday night combat > 
ce dernier est gratuit F2P... > 
succes temporaire car jeu toujours pété a l'équilibrage... > 
fermerture des serveur et suppression de SMNC... >
retour a MNC, toujours aussi pété mais completement abandonné.

au final, on a un jeu, vendu sur steam.. mais completement mort. mais c'est pas le F2P .. nope nope.. c'est bel et bien celui qui est payant.


franchement, évité ce jeu, il etait déja pas fameux, mais aujourdhui il est mort. ne vous faite pas avoir.
mettez le dans les ignorés.

0/10 meme pas fun plus de 10 minutes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263427469', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 246, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1533826793}
review:
I think the game was great in 2011. It offered a fresh gameplay with good graphics, jokes and co-op feature. Devs shut down co-op recently. Single game is boring, there are better titles on the market. So, the game just got old.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1471649515
The game basically has the same gameplay as Orc Must Die and Sanctum but with much less content.
There are 6 heroes with different style of game. Every hero has 2 weapons and different parameters. There are 4 towers which can be upgraded 3 times. There are 10-15 types of enemies. 

There is no single campaign. You just start one of 6 missions and play. First 5 are incredibly boring (there is no difficulty settings). The last one is tough, but, come on, there is only 1 interesting map... tt

The main feature is co-op. I think it is much more fun to play it with 4 players, but.. servers was shut down, so you can play only local... and I don't think you will find teammates in your neighborhood.

I liked concept of the world and a lot of jokes. Characters are funny and remind me Team Fortress.
In total, i think the game was good in 2011, but it can be good in present

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1471649570
Pros
- Nice concept of the world with a lot of jokes
- 6 heroes with different gameplay style

Cons
- The game was designed for co-op, but servers was shut down
- Single game has 6 maps. First 5 are incredibly boring. The last one is not enough to make the game good
- Only 4 towers
- Small enemy bestiary

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1471649647
[h1]Resume[/h1]
The game could get great, but it lacks of content. There are just towers and several types of enemies. There are a few maps and just 6 heroes. The game was designed to play co-op, but server was shut down. Single player is boring. I can't recommend this game in 2018.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961383682', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1515543221}
review:
Disregard the "8" hours on here. I have over 1,000 on the console versions and picked this up to see if anyone still played it here.

This game is one of the greatest games of all time. Still currently the best 3rd person action-MOBA, and it's a dead game.
The art style captured in this game, mixed with the humor completely inspired games like StarBlood Arena (mixed with Decent), and made other bigger games like SMITE and Paragon possible.

The only con is that the devlopers are convinced their RTS title somehow could ever top the masterpiece of Monday Night Combat.

Whatever you're doing Uber Entertainment, drop it for a MNC 3, or some big sister version.

Thanks for reading, and PLAY THIS GAME!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993919345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1327651200}
review:
This game was a lot of fun! I'm just sad that the devs quickly moved on to Super Monday Night Combat which wasn't as fun but was the only game my friends would play because they were cheapskates and didn't want to spend money. The entry fee of $20 (the original price) was fair and everyone was on pretty equal footing. It was pretty much a cross between TF2 (before the accessory nonsense) and a MOBA.

Then Super Monday Night Combat came along with its Mobile Game economy (free to play, pay to win) and both games' communities just died. If you can get a fair number of friends together (at least 8 total people), go ahead and give this game a try. It can certainly keep you going through a LAN party (if anyone still holds those any more) or if you're bored on a Monday night, just hop on and do some Monday Night Combat!

review:
The Lethality in this game, atleast in my personal opinion, was super awesome, made the game "Unique Moba",
The level difference didn't matter so much, and only gave an edge against others but that's it,

Then came the Free version of it aaaaand... was good... as "Yet Another MOBA", they removed Lethality, level difference is so vast as you cannot recover if the enemy level up faster than you, it's simply "Just another MOBA" while the older MNC was like "Alright, we're in? LOCK AND LOAD!" 

But that's just how I see it, funny how the devs Abandoned their own Uniqueness to join the "Me too, Me too" bandwagon~

author: {'steamid': '76561198015003424', 'num_games_owned': 1496, 'num_reviews': 256, 'playtime_forever': 615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 615, 'last_played': 1463011768}
review: Monday Night Combat was a really fun game when it came out, mixing first person class-based combat, similar to Team Fortress 2, and MOBA elements, with the excitement of the Super Bowl. Unfortunately, it was never well balanced and the developers soon suicided the game by releasing a standalone free-to-play version called Super Monday Night Combat that split the player base and eventually resulted in the slow inglorious death of both games. If you can find someone to play with, MNC is a rather unique and exciting experience, otherwise it is just another sad case of untimely death and wasted potential.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005408513', 'num_games_owned': 1045, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1143, 'last_played': 1356940800}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972040704', 'num_games_owned': 1835, 'num_reviews': 724, 'playtime_forever': 1078, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1078, 'last_played': 1318921200}
review:
Competitive multiplayer usually isn't something I like, but I actually did have some fun with Monday Night Combat. It has characters you can pick with different skills, offering an up-close perspective in a MOBA sort of game, that appealed to me despite MOBAs generally turning me off a great deal.

Word on the street, however, is that finding enough players to play much is tough to do these days. That's the downside to games that are basically multiplayer-only: someday they will generally wither away and die, even if they're good, with rare exception.

Without a lot of people to play with online, the game isn't really playable, though. =/

review:
Game's dead. Single player content is not high quality and if you want what it has I'd recommend [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/201790/]Orcs Must Die! 2[/url]

The games successor "Super Monday Night Combat" is also dead/probably out of business by now. I wouldn't recommend it either since there are blatant speedhackers in the game who can pretty much instantly win the game with the bow & arrow character (since there is no reload required she can shoot at 10x speed with no reload). Like if you could kill the enemy titan in smite with 20 seconds of the game starting pretty much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065395986', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1549357787}
review:
Played this game for a while (as of writing this review it was 5 hrs). Maybe the game is still dead in case of Multiplayer (there is one server left with 0 people in it) but Singleplayer is still good and very challenging. It's a good mix of tower defense and shooter. Maybe the graphics for some people will be dated but it's ok. Also love the fact of upgrading not only the turrets but also our character. One of the good aspects is that you can make your own character and give it some of your favourite abilities and it's still not overpowered. 

Overall this game is pretty good even when multiplayer is long dead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152715567', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1617946853}
review:
This was one of my favorite games back on the early days of the 360, and is a really nice introduction into some Smite or Paragon MOBA-esque mechanics.  Such a shame that a really entertaining game like this had to die out (kind of like Savage Resurrection).  Even though the MNC community is completely dead, there are still 2 dedicated servers that I know of that are still running.  So if you have 3 other friends, and those 3 friends don't mind spending 5 bucks, this is an amazing game to play, even just 2v2.  SMNC is free, but it feels and plays very different to MNC.  

MNC combat is more dependent on your third-person shooter skills than SMNC.  Althought there are lane minions and towers like a MOBA, you don't have to worry about an item shop or counter building your enemy.  You can even switch classes on the fly nbd.  Maps are pretty varied, but are stuck to one lane of minions per team (usually), which turns out fine if you're only playing 2v2 (game doesn't make bots to fill in players spots D:).  However, there's a ton of verticality and variances in lines of sight (except for the 2 gimmicky maps) in this game.  So if you're thinking that one lane per team feels small or limiting, you'd be happily surprised.

Though this is not marketed as a MOBA, this is an economy game.  You get $$$ for taking out towers and minions, and get a lot for taking out boss minions and players.  Character progression is linear, but the $$$ can be used to buy extra lane minions (specific to each class), repair/buy/upgrade towers, detonate knockout bombs on the map (you can get kills through ring-outs), and buy a type of minion nuke (that is always placed in the center of the map and is only available at certain times --> causes huge, frantic firefights).  MNC has a pretty distinct art direction and tone, too.  The game is a sort of spoof or parody on televised football, so there are sports casters and advertisements for sponsors throughout your matches.  There's enough dialogue variations that what he says doesn't get old or annoying, and what is said is pretty funny.

If the game was still alive and/or you have friends to play with 7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035444225', 'num_games_owned': 1855, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1490001856}
review:
マルチだとMOBA、シングルだとタワーディフェンスになるゲーム。
出演するのはおっさんとロボット。時々、美女が紛れ込む。
スポーツ中継のような実況演出がゲームを盛り上げてくれる。

ただ、シングルだと単調になりがちで、早くに飽きてしまうかもしれない。
マルチプレイなら5つくらいある多彩なマップで陣取りゲームを楽しめるかと。

もっとも、2017年3月現在、オープンサーバーは誰もログインしていない。
友達を誘ったうえで遊んで欲しい。

それはそうと、スタッフロールに力入れすぎ。
パルクールおぢさんがチラチラ画面を動き回るので、そちらが気になってしまう。

author: {'steamid': '76561198050873044', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1512934792}
review: This game was truely amazing back when I played it on Xbox 360, but this game is completely and utterly DEAD.  When a game that's almost entirely multiplayer no longer has anyone playing it, it dies a true death the likes of which a single player game never could.  I honestly don't know why they still sell it on STEAM.  If you accidently buy this game I suggest you ask for your money back.

review: Ce jeu bourrin est un régal. Je préfère ce jeu aux autres doomlike (même si j'aime bien unreal tournement, c'est un peu le même genre d'ailleurs mais tourné en dérision, çà le rend vraiment fandard). Je m'amuse quasiement à chaque frag que j'en sois victime ou l'auteur. Tellement de façon de neutraliser son adversaire, Tellement de façon de remporter la mission. C'est un boulot d'équipe très plaisant, où tu congratule quasiement ton adversaire quand il te surprend ou bien ton coéquipier qui t'a vengé.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168921104', 'num_games_owned': 467, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2451, 'last_played': 1481550461}
review:
This game is dead, with only one server active that is empty. That being said, if you buy this game during the sale and persuade a few friends to buy it too, you could have a bit of fun with this game. During its peak, this game was a very popular and fun game however I didn't play the MNC series in it's prime so I never truly got to learn this game or SMNC, and am stuck with the blitz mode on this game. The Blitz mode, like SMNC can be played solo though at least, and I prefer the Blitz mode on this version as it feels way more relaxed and is a nice way to chillax and get rid of stress.

In conclusion, if you are looking for a multiplayer game to drop in and drop out of if you have no friends to play it with, then this game is not for you. However, when the game is on sale and your friends are willing to buy it to play with you, i'd say it is still worth the sale price despite being completely dead. Also the Blitz mode was worth the sale price in my opinion.

review:
The game is dead and no longer supported by the developers, however it is a fun game overall and I absolutely loved playing it back when there were active players.

I wouldn't recommend buying unfortunately due to the lack of active players :(

11/2019: I randomly had a few matches last month, there still seems to be a group of people that play it at times. if you can get a group together then the game is still really great! I had a blast! <3

there's also the single player mode, but that can get boring.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995132155', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 1269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1269, 'last_played': 1364713200}
review:
+ fun game to play with friends if you only have a short amount of time to play
+ fun announcer and bonuses

- expensive for what you get
- gets repetitive quickly
- the sequel was free and had way more content, this game was abandoned and not fully fleshed out

If you like basic, 3rd person shooter MOBAs, you will probably enjoy this--but it gets old fast; but good for brief matches.
It's a good game but it doesn't last.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129192749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 585, 'last_played': 1559002841}
review:
This game is so much fun. Back when it was released on Xbox 360 Arcade, so many people jumped into this game and it was a HUGE success. Sadly, Uber Ent went and forgot about the Xbox 360 community and gave more attention to the PC version. They gave us only the Spunky Cola special DLC but never gave us the Uncle Tully's map and other DLCs they said we'd get. Eventually, they abandoned MNC on both sides, PC and Xbox and decided to make Super MNC. Community responded by not supporting Super MNC like they were hoping us to. Instead we enjoyed MNC for a much as would could until it slowly withered away.

Currently, this game is dead. The game itself is fun if people decide to jump in again and play. If Uber Ent would just drop the price of $5 and make it Free to play and just add some skins to customize your appearance WHICH DOES NOT ADD ANY STATS BOOSTS AND IS SOLELY FOR COSMETIC PURPOSES! Then they can get some money and MAYBE the community will slowly begin to revive itself. If you and some friends would like to play this game together and against each other for fun and laughs, go for it. They do have a co-op mode called Blitz. Blitz is pretty much a survival mode where you survive wave after wave of bots and you need to protect the Money Ball from getting destroyed. Blitz can be played offline. Crossfire is the multiplayer mode, it can be played offline but splitscreen, no AIs are allowed in this game for either game mode.

Hope this information helps anyone decide whether they want to spend money and try the game with friends, or wait until if it ever goes Free to Play.

PS: I barely have hours on here because I mainly played back on Xbox 360 back in it's glory days.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035255990', 'num_games_owned': 1614, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 142050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 294, 'playtime_at_review': 74902, 'last_played': 1710622713}
review:
A simple fast paced team based shooter with moba like elements, pick from one of 6 classes each with their own unique skills and abillities. All classes have their strengths and weaknesses each with their own personality. Monday Night Combat is my favourite game on steam and always will be! Unfortunately the games playerbase is very limited, but with the help of the MNC community games are organised regularly. So don't threat too much about never being able to play. The commentator of the game spews out hilarious dialogue about your situation and the teams performance, the game even has a mascot that appears on the field that you can shoot for money and prizes!

Join the "hotshotsforever" group on steam to inform you of organised events.

Did I mention MNC is the most lethal sport of the future? ;)

Hiyo! 10/10! Oh!... And theres bacon! (see you on the field of combat!)

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198162195514', 'num_games_owned': 522, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1446768077}
review:
A game that would thrive with multiplayer, but nobody is playing. I have mixed feelings about the game because of this.

Pros:
- Decent gameplay mechanics
- Graphics are fitting (Unreal Engine)
- The announcer
- Shooting mascots
- Simple upgrade system

Cons:
- The tutorial blows through, leaving what it taught forgettable
- Nobody playing multiplayer
- Feels very abandoned by both, players and devs
- Singleplayer doesn't feel very diverse, just different difficulties
- Upgrade system might be a little too simple (not major, but it felt bland after other games)

Overall, I want to recommend MNC because it really could be fun, but the singleplayer leaves a lot to be desired and the multiplayer is dead. While playing single, I felt like I didn't want to be doing what I was doing, but rather sharing the job(s) with someone else. In the end, it simply needs more players in order to be more interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035552486', 'num_games_owned': 1314, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 957, 'last_played': 1331107200}

author: {'steamid': '76561198059481175', 'num_games_owned': 1885, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1403559183}
review:
Essentially a third-person, FPS/MOBA hybrid with a gameshow feel to it, Monday Night Combat has seemingly outlived it's hayday.

Monday Night Combat has some great features to it, nice sound, humorous announcers and characters.  There is a variety of weapons to use, the game has fun, bright, colorful graphics and visuals.  You can choose from 6 different classes for your character to try and combat the enemy team better.  The game, overall, seems like it would be pretty fun.

I say pretty fun, because if you're like me, and looking to jump into the game anytime now or afterwards, you will be disappointed.  The multiplayer servers have all but been shut down.  There is essentially no way to play this game multiplayer without gathering up your own friends to play and hosting your own game, otherwise, there's really nobody left to play the game, and therefore I cannot recommend it.  It seems like it would have been fun if it had the kind of following the big MOBAs like LoL and Dota have today.

I cannot recommend this game to anyone, for any reason.  Without anyone to play the game with on the regular, this game is nothing more than a waste of money at this point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041178432', 'num_games_owned': 527, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1701305486}
review:
[h1] There is a warning at the bottom of this review, I reccomend you read it after the rest of the review before purchasing.[/h1]
tl;dr: Amazing, funny, fun team based third person shooter with minor MOBA elements that's saddly very, very dead currently. If you have friends and they're all willing, it's a fantastic game though.

I'll say this now, the original Monday Night Combat is one of my favorite games of all time.
It's a class based, PVP/PVE, team centric third person shooter set in a hilariously dark (but never seen) dystopian future where you compete as a group of clones fighting in a lethal sport in specially made and company branded arenas. 
Got all that? 
Oh and there's also upgrading skills, bacon, a mascot you shoot to get money, dual miniguns, half of the classes have jetpacks, light tower defense mechanics, taunting is a way you earn money AND a sexy mascot who's also the one providing you turrets?

There's light twinges of MOBAs in Monday Night Combat, but if that makes you cringe from past experiences with MOBAs, set it aside because everything is easy enough to understand and nowhere near as punishing as your typical MOBA.

The game plays like this: There are two teams, with "bases" on each side of the symmetrical map, each base has several spots where you can place turrets and a "money ball" to defend with its own shield which has to be destroyed for the other team to win. Each base also spawns bots (which can be killed to get cash)Act, which meet at the middle of the map and clash, but without players helping them out, they won't get far. The trick is that each money ball has a shield, one that can only be broken if a friendly bot reaches the enemy money ball. 
There's also the hilarious narrator who gives details about the setting and comments on how well you are playing. He doesn't really ever get old.
There's also a lot more I could talk about, like custom boost loadouts to be unlocked, each class has its own spawn-able bot type, chickey cantor... I could go on forever but I'll try to make this review short-er.

The good: It's funny, it's REALLY fun to play, it has a fantastic visual style, and the balancing is very good for the most part. It's just... really, really good. Also Chickey Cantor... gotta add at least a whole point on the review score for having a giant robotic chicken.

The bad: (Mostly nitpicks) Parts of it haven't aged so well, such as parts of the gunplay. The balance isn't perfect as that a few clases in the right hands can almost steamroll such as The Support and The Sniper. Losing isn't very fun, and sometimes you can get stuck in a losing game without much way of getting back up due to some bad investments. 

It's overall a fantastic game.
[b]HOWEVER, WARNING[/b]
Here's where the sad part of the review comes in... right now the multiplayer community is, except for a few groups who meet occasionally, pretty much dead. If you're wondering about my hours played being something like 1.6 or 1.9, it's because most of this game I played on the Xbox LIVE version, which had fewer maps and costumes but was still the same damn game you can buy here, and feels great with and without a controller. 
There's also Super Monday Night Combat, the Free 2 play "sequel" is available, which more or less dumbed down the importance of the shooty bits and made it feel a bit more like a typical MOBA, but also added a whole new roster of characters and another announcer that makes it twice as funny as the original MNC. It's also dead, but you can unlock items for TF2 and vice-versa. 
As for this game... most of what you can do now is join groups like [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/hotshotsforever] Hotshots Forever [/url]. Sad to see such a good game go.

review:
It was great fun while it lasted. it had some minor balance issues and some acievements and protags took insanely long to farm, but the core gameplay was quite fun and the dedicated servers were nice.
But as it is, the game is quite sadly dead. In many ways I think it does what it does better than the sequel Super Monday Night Combat, and I just can't recommend a multiplayer game with a dead community, it wouldn't be a good purchase choice.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999151078', 'num_games_owned': 830, 'num_reviews': 289, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1435260670}
review:
Monday Night Combat had a nice aesthetic that captured the feel of a sports show, with an intriguingly unnerving game world, and interesting if somewhat flawed gameplay that was at least worth a look.

Too bad there is exactly one (1) dedicated server still running.


This game was basically a third-person shooter/MOBA hybrid with tower defense elements. (The free-to-play, pay-to-win sequel Super Monday Night Combat - which is currently only slightly less abandoned and which suffered from technical issues - was even more MOBA-like.)

Players chose from one of six classes that each played different roles, and money collected on the battlefield or earned from kills could be used to build turrets and upgrade player abilities. The range of mechanics available to the player was a bit confusing for newcomers even if less complex than any actual MOBA, especially when veteran TPS/MOBA players found the game more intuitive.

The two main modes were Blitz, which saw you and your team defending your Moneyball against hordes of robots, and Crossfire, which pitted your team against another team in a 6v6 game to destroy the other team's Moneyball with the help of allied robots; more or less DotA as a shooter.

The tutorial was basic: it only taught the basics of gameplay and how to play one class. Players had to consult more in-depth guides in order to effectively learn about the game.


MNC's world was briefly glimpsed yet revealing: it painted a picture of a totalitarian, consumerist society akin to the Roman Empire that hinted at darker aspects of our own world, where the downtrodden lower classes watched Monday Night Combat for cheap thrills.

The game's cartoony graphics weren't so stellar even when maxed out, but they served their purpose, and you wouldn't really have played this for the graphics anyway. Player customization was pretty good though, letting players choose outfits for the classes and pick a title to display gained from completing in-game achievements, such as killing a certain number of enemies. And the characters - the Pros - had some nice diversity going on: a Hawaiian, an African-American, and a woman comprised three of the six characters.

Overall, despite some flaws, the game was fun enough to earn a decently sized playerbase back in the day.


Okay, you're probably curious about my use of past tense, not to mention my implication that the game is dead. Well...

Official servers were shut down in 2012. The playerbase relies on two [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/hotshotsforever]Steam[/url] [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/longlivemnc]groups[/url] to gather players for matches either on the lone public server or temporary private ones, and you can bet that most of their small number are skilled enough to utterly stomp newer players.

There's single-player Blitz available, but there is no single-player Crossfire with AI players, which means that the Crossfire-related achievements are pretty much extremely difficult to get - and are practically no longer attainable without farming. And that's terrible.


So what happened to Monday Night Combat?

Lack of support is the most obvious problem. Microsoft wouldn't let developers Uber Entertainment update the 360 version, and they ran out of money to keep updating the PC version. The small team of devs had to jump through a lot of hoops just to get the game released. This led to disengagement from the community and an inability to address their concerns.

Polygon ran [url=http://www.polygon.com/features/2013/3/19/4094472/uber-hail-mary-monday-night-combat]an article[/url] that illustrated these problems; it's worth reading if you're curious.

Tying into the inability to be engaged with and work on the game, MNC's balance wasn't all that good either from what I can tell. Skilled Snipers and Assaults were difficult to counter. Cheesy tactics abounded, such as excessive use of ricocheting weapons and sniping turrets from outside their range rendering them somewhat ineffective for point defense.

The ability for players to supercharge, and the use of what was basically a doomsday weapon located in the center of every arena, meant a losing team could effectively blunt the winning team's progress if they gained the upper hand. Hackers were a problem, the lack of community development tools/an SDK was a different problem; Tanks, Gunners and grapples were borderline overpowered off the bat, while the Assassin was apparently underpowered.


The only way you can [i]really[/i] play this game now is to gather a group of friends and host your own server. I suppose that since this game originally came out in 2010, it could only have lasted for so long. It's a shame the devs didn't include player AI for Crossfire mode - even with its flaws, that's the one thing that would have ultimately saved this game from its ignoble death.

At least Uber Entertainment survived, and would go on to create large-scale RTS [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/233250/]Planetary Annihilation[/url] - another flawed yet interesting game.

The little time I spent with Monday Night Combat was pretty fun, and it certainly had potential. The [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fdVThYnVrpY]main menu song[/url] was pretty good, at any rate. But I really cannot recommend it.

Oh, well. The TF2 promo items were nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015171654', 'num_games_owned': 1081, 'num_reviews': 306, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1552939202}
review:
I would like this game a lot more if there were people online to play with. But maybe I'm on at the wrong times. I dunno. Point is, it gets old just playing with Computers all the time. 

That being said, I'm still gonna recommend this game. The mode I always somehow end up playing is the one with robots. It's as if TF2's Mann vs Machine got refined and got some more modes of game play. For those of you not familiar with what I just reference, Mann vs Machine is a mode in TF2 where you battle robots of varying classes and once defeated drop money. If you successfully complete all 7 waves, you can then take the cash they drop to fund upgrades for whatever class you are playing. So the fact that this game is completely different but feels like another, I find very cool. 

Also, maybe I'm just playing this game wrong. You can tell from my logged hours I don't play much so I may be missing a lot. But if I can find a server with actual people playing, I'd be more likely to play more. But it seems I'll be waiting forever..

author: {'steamid': '76561198012762190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1423826659}
review:
I bought this game for about 10 bucks (one copy for a friend of mine, one for me), expecting it to be a great co-op and PvP game, after reading the glowing reviews and the way it is advertised on Steam.

What can i say? Don't bother. There's a good game in there but you can hardly play it. The first thing i noticed were input and settings related bugs. Then crashes. But worst of all, no servers and the inability to actually create a co-op room and invite you friends (remember, it was advertised to have this feature).

If you're lucky, you may still find a dedicated server, which most likely will be empty. If you create your own lobby, you will be unable to invite your friends and your friends won't be able to see it in the server browser (we tried it, multiple times and with multiple settings/solutions).

The only way to play this online, is to get into one of the two empty servers i have found and let your friend join them too. The downside is, you can't select the game mode or map and you most likely end up in opposing teams (1vs1 basically).

It's a shame, really, because the game itself promoses to be fun. I don't care if this was released on 2011. It's still sold and advertised on steam and i expect the advertised features to work. It may be "just" 10 bucks, but i want it back anyway.

This game is the straw that broke the camel's back and i will refrain from buying anything on steam for a while.

EDIT: I should probably add this to the review: There is still a group on steam that plays the game, but don't expect to see more than one server with people on it -ever- (and I love this group for that, I missed this game so badly), and don't expect to see even that 80% of the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997302239', 'num_games_owned': 1157, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1678854587}
review:
This game is AMAZING.

I originally purchased it on Xbox 360 back in 2010 after I fell in love playing the trial version. (This was back when people actually played the game, and the servers weren't totally dead.) I think that was when the MOBA craze was just taking off, but this did something original with the formula that I hadn't seen anywhere before... It's a class-based shooter like TF2 but the game plays like League of Legends -- you protect your home base's "crystal" from the opposing team's minions (all different kinds of robots, in this case). What makes this formula even more interesting is that your "towers" (turrets) are selected and upgraded by YOU and your team using the "gold" you get from killing the enemy team and their minions. And to top this all off, it has a crazy, silly, cartoony atmosphere and art style, and it acts like it's a reality game show/sport (hence the title), complete with a witty announcer.

I picked up a 4-pack for super cheap a few months ago to share with friends, but... Sadly, since no one really plays it anymore, all you're really left with is the 1-4 player "tower defense" co-op mode -- you choose your turrets to defend against waves of the different kinds of robots and defend your crystal.

Eventually, they released a sequel in 2012 (Super MNC), but it was a free-to-play, microtransaction mess only available on PC. It was awkward and boring with none of the charm of the original (read: hat simulator), and I don't think anyone plays that anymore either.

Really, MNC is the predecessor to the likes of Smite, Gigantic (RIP), and MOBAs in general... If you can pick this game up for a buck or two, maybe you could get some friends together to play it, even if it's just the co-op mode. Sure, you didn't get to play it in its heyday, but you still get to play something different.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091515827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1493622423}
review:
Monday Night Combat is a fantastic third person shooter that combines tower defense with a little bit of MOBA.  The graphics are appealing to look at especially if you're into the cartoony TF2 style, and the game plays very smoothly.  Overall a very fun experience and perfectly priced.

So why am I not recommending this?  For one simple reason; the company behind this game seriously fucked up everything that made it even playable.  

All servers are down, and to make it worse you can't even create your own without the game just crashing on you.  So the only way to play this game is to play it solo, which defeats the entire purpose of a fun multiplayer tower defense game.  I had a lot of good things to say about this one, but in its current state I can't recommend it.  

In the famous words of The Angry Video Game Nerd: "What's the most important aspect of any game?  Being able to fucking play it!"

author: {'steamid': '76561198119333163', 'num_games_owned': 1114, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1650050325}
review: I reccomend this game because it's fun and better than the new one. The classic Blitz mode where you go up against waves of bots with up to 3 friends or randoms. Crossfire mode where you have to take out the enemy moneyball with your bots before they take out yours. How could you forget about the lovable Bullseye (The MNC mascot) who you can shoot for money! "If you brought your sniper rifle from home, than you could take some shots at Bullseye and get a few bucks off the field!" (not an exact quote) Although it may be a bit difficult to find a game all the time, there is still a loyal community that hosts events to play on the weekend or weeknights. One being Hotshots Forever (http://steamcommunity.com/groups/hotshotsforever/discussions/0/630802344396119611/) ,Had to put a discussion because the homepage wouldn't work, a group I am in myself (personally, I prefer Icemen, or the Blue team in games). I don't think it's overpriced for the amount of fun you can still have so I say, gr8 game m8 I r8 8/8.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976489900', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1709535852}
review:
Do [b]NOT[/b] buy this game nor its free pay-to-play counterpart, [i]Super Monday Night Combat[/i]. 

The developer, [i]Uber Entertainment[/i], has [u]abandoned[/u] support for this game for more than a year; not officially, mind you, but dead silence on anything from the company on the MNC/SMNC front as they are concentrating support on another game of theirs.

While this is a fun, balanced 3rd person MOBA, mixing Team Fortress 2 and DOTA, as well as being one of the few games that is not only ACTUALLY hilarious, unlike other games where the jokes are funny once and never again, this has such an extensive library of well-written lines, it is sad that the developer decided to sabotage the game for a quick buck via the F2P & in-game store model. 

Save your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127856583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1610773871}
review:
Я конечно не знаю что вдохновило разработчиков этой игры на создание - Monday night Combat, что в переводе - Понедельник, ночь, Драка о_0, но игра действительно уникальна, а уникальности ей придает не ее боевая система, локации, или персонажи... А колорит, стиль этой игры, о нём ниже .

Вся игра предвстает пред игроком в виде гиганской арены на которой проводятся бои, 2 команды (Синие и Оранжевые) дружно вешают друг другу люлей подручными предметами, (а если точно - Пулеметами, ПП, базуками, плазменными резаками, и прочими огнестрельными прелестями) Арен естевственно несколько типов, на каждой присутствуют Т.Т (Турельные точки) из которых игрок может постоить приглянувшуюся ему турель которая будет отстреливать всё приближающееся что не покрашено в цвет вашей команды. А в частности ботов, которые есть у каждой команды, и которые одним маршрутом передвигаются к базе противника (и это не те боты которые втыкают на просторах локаций в игровых скинах, это линейные боты которые следуют определенному маршруту, и ресаются "волнами", уровень интелекта (ИИ) таких ботов колеблется между - уровнем ии Чайного пакетика и губной помады)

Естевственно на базе каждой команды есть что-то "эдакое" что команда противника должна заполучить или ликвидировать, и в случае этой игры это -Денежный шар- при ликвидации которого из него выпадает гиганское количество монет, символизируя о том что проигравшая команда теперь банкроты. 
Но конечно-же даже создатели столь необычной игры не могли обойтись без старого-доброго занюханого оборонительного режима, который есть в большинсве игр, он как... как Калаш, Вездесуш и Вечен.
В этом самом оборонительном режиме вам как всегда прийдется оборонятся от орды тупых как валянок ботов, с целью продержатся как можно дольше. Тут то и открывается вся уникальность этой игры, Вы появляетесь на арене и вроде-бы всё как всегда... Турели есть, Денежный шар есть, член на месте парик тоже, чего-же не хватает? Орды дибилковатых ботов? да нет вот она... И что же изменилось? а то что на ботах Рекламы похлеще чем на Маршрутках, (хорошо что бренды рекламы придуманы и созданы самими разработчиками) а то представьте себе ситуацию, минут 40 отстреливались от роботов, большой палец правой ноги сломан, под глазом фингал, бронежилет (в про100народье телогрейка) порван в баню! в ухе топор, патроны на исходе, и тут... выползает финальный босс, гиганский как косяк у Марадонны, и опасный как челябинский хомячок, а на ж_пе у него накатано -Прокладки Always сухо даже когда мокро!- ваша реакция на это похлеще чем у гопника на iphone. 

Ну и кончено просирать своё время в Оборонительном режиме, вы сможете со своими друзьями которые наверняка оценят творчество поддатых но изобретательных разработчиков - MnC.

Надеюсь у вас хватило терпения дочитать мой обзор на сей шедевр до конца , а если нет то хотя-бы другие мои обзоры прочитай, они не менее ржачные чем твоя бабушка в панталонах.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069792862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1396393952}
review: This is a good game with a pro game feel (even if undeserved, I don't know because I stopped playing after a few weeks.) However, for whatever reason, it has died. There are no more servers. The only way you could reliably play is if you were to play with all people you knew. Dont' get the wrong idea, single player can still be fun when you need a heart-pounding time waster. However, if you want to see how you match up to everyone else, dont' expect to be able to. They made a free to play version which flopped and now neither ever see the light of day. I fully blame the free to play. This version has been fixed and balanced out and deserves more attention. Don't expect Uber to fulfill promises about it. Don't expect anything you don't like to be fixed. Expect to have fun with friends but not on public servers. Until public servers become full again, it's not worth the investment. Also, don't encourage SMNC either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016989392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1843, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
It'd get a thumbs-up: but Uber Entertainment has ditched MNC for Super Monday Night Combat, which then flopped about helplessly thanks to a Free To Play setup and being dropped like an ugly baby by Uber Entertainment not long after its conception.

Both games are dead and I'm writing this review purely to get it out of my system:
MNC *was* fun, had its fixable flaws, but then it got stabbed and left for dead in an alleyway. 

"Oh now that... is what Monday Night Combat is all about! (sobbing) You said it wouldn't hurt but it does!" - Mickey Cantor

author: {'steamid': '76561198017548179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2194, 'last_played': 1708308113}
review:
The Down Side to steam.
Days of buying a game and actually being able to play it are over. When i bought this game I assumed(big mistake) that the developer would support it for more then half a year. Not possible I guess.

Thanks to steam you don't really need to be serious about entertainment to put out a game. No need to design a box, set up distribution, invest in alternative forms of advertising or just put a solid effort into it. Now you can just take the initial influx of money that you received from all the rubes that thought a business had to stand behind their products, pull op anchor, sail around the island, drop anchor in the exact same place and sell the exact same crap again.

I recommend this game or any game UBER entertainment regurgitates to all the rubes in all the lands.

Monday Night Combat
Super Monday Night Combat
Planetary Annihilation
Loadout(I am told it's not an UBER game but they use the same resources as SMNC and it's just another knock off of the same game.)
