author: {'steamid': '76561198032788858', 'num_games_owned': 1105, 'num_reviews': 678, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1394290900}
review:
Практически TF, только без шапок.

Завязка проста и понятна - обычные стадионные развлечения уже не имеют высоких рейтингов, людишкам нужна кровища. Вот вы теперь на гладиаторских боях и будете её проливать. Правда игрушка скорее мультяшно-нейтральная как TF, чем кишкопоказывающая. А ну и классы бойцов слизаны/позаимствованы/выпрошены у TF - шпионка, пулеметчик, медик-инженер, снайпер, огнеметчик и подрывник-летун. Однако есть и отличие, прокачка на лету и безмозглые боты-тушки а-ля DOTA. Однако у игры мало контента, режимов игры и карт кот наплакал. Видимо именно поэтому (ну и продолжение вышло же) сейчас мало кто в это дело играет, да что там мультик практически мертв.

Прыгни с гранатой! 6 из 10 :)

review:
A solid few hours of fun, no gripes. Not terribly into this slew of post- Borderlands games that desperately try for the "we're cartoony TOO!" aesthetic, despite this one being much more akin to TF2 in that regard but my point stands.


Anyway, grab it during a sale, I doubt you'll be disappointed, but its F2P descendant would be a more viable option.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053936652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1359964800}
review:
LOVE THIS GAME
MNC reminded me of Airmech when i found it; another great, entertaining FREE game with many many awesome features & nearly infinite replay value.

Just one problem, also same as Airmech (& others):  
Nobody is playing it. At least nobody was when i found it. I'll check back & hope it gets popular, but in the past i rarely found anyone to play with. Too bad everyone's playing WoW and LoL.

I give this game 9/10, but if nobody is playing it, that makes it unplayable. Too bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981047937', 'num_games_owned': 7422, 'num_reviews': 437, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1375287171}
review:
Once upon a time at a convention a dude just followed me around for five minutes yelling "traaaaaash boooooat" until a panel started, then he fucked off to go see Kevin Smith juggle his man-tits or whatever. If I ever ran into Monday Night Combat in the street, I would do the same thing to it.

The heckling, not the tit-juggling. I assure you my hands would go nowhere near the game's chest, it would be improper.

I suppose I should explain why: game was dead long before SMNC came out, and SMNC is the karmic backlash they deserved for abandoning a playable-at-worst title like MNC without learning from any of its mistakes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000422381', 'num_games_owned': 826, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 11477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11477, 'last_played': 1307343600}
review:
Eghh... Dont buy this game.  Its a rage inducing MOBA style game with a horrible community and a bunch of patches that threw everything out of whack without fixing a pretty awful class imbalance.  It has some nice distinct style and the announcer adds a ton of character to this game, but... just don't.

I haven't looked back since I quit but I wouldn't be surprised if it has been all but abandoned by the devs since they made the free-to-play version (Super MNC), and I'm almost certain the community is dead too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011519956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1392585424}
review:
Umm... figures they don't tell you that all the servers are dead.  I hopped on the servers Sunday afternoon, and it was a ghost town.  Absolutely no one there.  Sad.  I recall first playing this game when it first came out & they promoted Free Play - and the servers were alive.  They added a League-of-Legends like map that I was hoping to catch in live-action, but again - the servers are dead.

If you like playing tennis with yourself; that is, you hit the ball hoping someone or something will hit it back to you - this games for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988089473', 'num_games_owned': 564, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2187, 'last_played': 86400}

author: {'steamid': '76561198002416112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 88117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 134, 'playtime_at_review': 78535, 'last_played': 1710622678}
review:
This game is a class based TPS (Third Person Shooter). When I think about it the only thing this game & TF2 have in common is that they are both class based games.
In this game you have a choice between six classes: Assault, Tank, Gunner, Support,  Sniper, or Assassin. The first few weeks, even months at times, will be very frustrating & hard because the game's learning is curve is just way too steep to actually just get in & start owning back & forth. That will usually apply unless you are using some kind of third party program to gain advantage.
Most people make the mistake of thinking that this game is totally like TF2, & thus if they were good at TF2 expect very similar results here. I being one of those people I found out the hard way that being a good TF2 player really has no science. TF2's learning curve is very low so that people will get used to it. On my own personal experience all of the people who have this game, & played right after coming out of TF2 has raged.
NOTE: For all those people who are coming from Super Monday Night Combat please understand that this is a completely different game. Different game genre too. The only similarities are a few of the characters, bots, & abilities.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970739339', 'num_games_owned': 674, 'num_reviews': 563, 'playtime_forever': 805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 805, 'last_played': 86400}
review: I want to like this game. But I don't. All the fun of leveling a character and shooting rcomputer-controlled enemies just falls to shit when you have to face another player, an experience I've had in several MOBAs (I'm looking at you, League of Losers). MNC has the tactical depth and player base of your typical free to play game, while demanding skill and and dedication better spent on TF2. And I can say that with a completely straight face, because TF2 at least USED to be about skill and dedication. MNC only pretended to be. Then again, you can just play Blitz, which I always found much more fun. The fact that MNC's upcoming sequel IS a free to play game with microtransactions simply hammers home my point. If you MUST play such a game, at least play Tribes: Ascend. At least until they fuck THAT up. If they haven't already, I haven't decided yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002302834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
クラス性のDotaっぽいTPS。モードは対戦と耐久Coopがある。
Dotaのように相手陣地に攻め込むBotが沸く。相手陣地のクリスタルを壊せば勝ち。
コンセプトは悪くないと思うのだがプレイしてて何かが足りない感がある。平たく言えばあまり面白くなかった。
対戦モードは最大で6vs6なのだが、これが原因だと思う。多分。
XBLAでも発売されていて、XBLA準拠になっちゃってるのが良くない気がしなくもない。
続編の超まんこが出るとか出ないとか。F2Pになるらしいから確かみてみろ

author: {'steamid': '76561197987755126', 'num_games_owned': 1714, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1639328091}
review:
On prend un tower defense on y ajoute des éléments de gameplay propre à Team Fortress 2 y comprit le coté "stylisé" et on obtient l'un des meilleurs titres.

Deux camps s'opposent, le but est de détruire la "Money-Ball" de ses adversaires, qui se situe au sein de leur base. 
Vous contrôlez un personnage, choisi parmi 6 classes et qui doit à la fois repousser les assauts des ennemis et attaquer leur base. 

Des vagues d'unités contrôlées par la machine sont là pour vous aider et vous pouvez également placer des tourelles défensives.

En réalité il s'agit d'un tower defence ce voulant dynamique ce qui est plutôt un bon point pour ces jeux où l'on est souvent spectateur, mais en regardant de plus près on peu ce rendre compte qu'il vaut vraiment le détours.

16/20

author: {'steamid': '76561197980125232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 52641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49574, 'last_played': 1678575466}
review:
I stand by giving this game 9/10 however since the developer has stopped all support including multiplayer servers I can't in good conscience recommend this game anymore.

The best way to describe this is as TF2 meets DotA.  A third person class based shooter where the objective is to escort your bots into the enemies base destroying enemies, bots and turrets in your way.  New players may find the concept of having to kill bots rather than human opponents confusing at first but it is worth getting past the initial learning curve.  Just don't decide to play as the assassin on your first outings as you will likely suck at it until you have learnt the game mechanics and your team will hate you.

9/10

review: This is a fantastic game of quick reflexes, stratagey and general skill. The player has to decide whether to spend their money on towers to defend their base, on bots to help push forward to the opponents money ball or to upgrade your skills. There are 6, well balanced classes to choose from, each with their own skills that define them and make them strong to certain class but weak to others. Overall, a fun, entertaining and well balanced game that never gets old.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016273116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1115, 'last_played': 1376593639}
review: Fun game, third person shooter/tower defense. Revolves around a ball of money contained in a sphere, called the Money Ball. Can play competitively, with both teams trying to get their swarms of robots to the enemy's moneyball to destroy it and win, or co-operatively, protecting the moneyball against increasingly difficult hordes of robots. Killing bots (or other players) gets you money, which you can spend on single-game character upgrades or turrets. And turret upgrades. While most games would pit red team against blue team, this game has ORANGE vs Blue, which is fine by me - orange is blue's actual opposite, after all. The characters don't have as much individual personality as Team Fortress 2's characters (which are hard to beat, kind of an unfair comparison?), but personalities do exist - most visibly with the Support class character. Good for those that enjoy both tower defense and third person shooters. If you prefer tower defense, play Blitz as a Support.

review: After trying to get this game to work on my computer, I have finally played this and MNC is basically a monday night football game with guns and combat. The game is very Dota like with Team Fortress 2 elements. You can choose classes too which some are similiar to TF2. Like the MNC assassin in comparasion to the TF2 spy. So the objective in this game, well one of them I played is moneyball. So teams with their classes need to escort so bots so they can take down defenses of the other team's moneyball and get some loot. So pretty fun. The flaw in this game might be the lack of new content, but the community is very very small. There are about 55 servers, but at day time, only a couple are filled in. I wouldn;t buy this game because there is hardly anyone toplay with. Wait for Super MNC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043003447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1397880739}
review: At first glance, Monday Night Combat has the makings of a forgettable game. The braying announcer welcomes you to a simplistic session of shooting mindless robots in a bland neon arena.  But if you push beyond the lackluster first impression, you'll find that those mindless robots are put to very good use in this surprisingly entertaining shooter. Monday Night Combat cleverly infuses the familiar dynamic of objective-based competitive play with tower defense mechanics to create a novel combat experience. The clever combat design and well-tuned class complexity make this a great online multiplayer class-and-team-based, third-person tower defense shooter. And if that's a bit wordy for you, then just call Monday Night Combat a very addictive and very entertaining game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990152763', 'num_games_owned': 2031, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 2157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2157, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
Super Monday Night combat replaced this, basicaly going from traditional development to wacky Freemium buy our shit frenzy.

Uber's reluctance to just say they lied about ever doing a map maker for the community was the final nail in its coffin. Don't buy it. Don't touch their other one either unless you want to waste time in a largely dead game, because surprise, they couldn't manage this one, they definately couldn't handle the Dota like.

If this was on sale for a dollar, I'd light that dollar on fire and get more enjoyment then out of this dead neglected game.

Thanks Uber, You made a fun game, killed it, replaced it with something similar but more money grubbing, and killed that too.
If you are going to make something for PC, make it for PC, don't pander and try to maximize profits under the guise of understanding PC players.

review: Цель игры такова: сопроводить роботов к золотому шару соперника и уничтожить его. Класы игроков напоминают персонажей из TF2. По ходу раунда можно улучшать характеристики персонажа. За убийство ботов или игроков даються деньги, за которые можно улучшить персонажа или построить пушки которые будут защишать ваш шар от ботов или игроков. Скажу чесно, хоть игра и содержит некие скопированые функции или режими с TF2, она все равно кажется довольно интересной и увлекательной.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963034532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 623, 'last_played': 1323504000}
review: I like this game because it's got a bunch of angry men who hate robots, but are willing to tolerate robots of their own colour because they hate robots of other colours even more. I think this game's subtexts of tolerance and racism ring true to the world at large. It teaches us lessons like don't taunt the Assassin just because she is a woman, and don't scoff at robots just because they are blue and you are not, especially not the fast robots that love hugging. I think they're called huggers. Star Trek The Next Generation was good about this kind of thing, too. I bet Monday Night (who names his kid "Monday"?) took to heart Gene Roddenberry's deep meaningful messages, like how Geordi, a terrifying man-eating cyborg engineer, can befriend Data even though Data is a robot of a different colour from Geordi. But wait, no. The guys in Monday Night's Combat are enemies with their off-colour robotic counterparts! I don't get this at all. Where have you gone so wrong, Mr Night?

author: {'steamid': '76561197976692428', 'num_games_owned': 1078, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
This game had a lot of potential. It was fun during the summer event for a few days when there were tons of players of all skill levels. I really enjoyed it at first.
Not many maps or modes. Hardly any players on now. If you do find a populous server, chances are, you'll be playing against veteran players. I hope you enjoy players constantly giving themself full HP or freezing you to no end or being showered with explosives spam. The assassins are pretty easy to take care of, though. I'm just a touch from level 10, so maybe I haven't fully experienced what the game has to offer. With the way things are, I've lost all interest in doing so.
I'm sure the game is very rewarding for those who've spent countless hours mastering the game with its miniscule amount of maps and modes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000879653', 'num_games_owned': 2694, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1395464888}
review:
I'm afraid I can't recommend this game any more. Not because it's bad; it's an amazingly fun multiplayer game that's a sort of hybrid of the best aspects of MOBA and shooter. It's just that nobody plays it any more; the entire remaining active community has congregated to 2 groups of fewer than 300 members, neither of has posted much of anything within the last three months as of this edit. You may be able to have fun with this game's sequel, Super Monday Night Combat, but that game's much more of a MOBA than this one was.

Original review below.

What is it? Not TF2!
What's it like? TF2!

No hats or free-to-play. There's a title system but it hasn't affected anything so far as far as I can tell.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997031234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1346742000}
review: Monday Night Combat at a glance is a mix of Dota, Tower Defense, and Team Fortress 2 in one. The Dota aspects are in the idea of defending a Moneyball while spewing out minions to attack it. Tower Defense comes in as turrets to shoot these robot minions. The class based teams of Team Fortress 2 are in the characters players use to control their class. Now, the game adds its own series of unique spins by putting it in 3rd person and having its own challenges. The single player mode is to defend the Moneyball while multiplayer is to attack the enemy and defend the objective. Unique gameshow type minigames are in each mode, where players have the opportunity to shoot a mascot for prizes. Together as a mix it is confusing for newcomers to adapt to the style, but mastering it turns it into a load of fun. The technical aspects of the game mixed with its funny humor by characters and cartoony style make for a fun game. Monday Night Combat offers flexibility and humor in combination.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960467187', 'num_games_owned': 465, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 86400}

author: {'steamid': '76561197967485411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 86400}
review: Do you enjoy DOTA? League of Legends? Take those games, blast it into the future, and make it FPS. Thats Monday night combat,  you level up, you skill up, you purchase, you win. Excellent online multiplayer, and the announcer in -game really just sets the bar higher for next-gen games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963562298', 'num_games_owned': 3346, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1325923200}
review:
I'm having a tough time explaining why this game is so great, so just take my word on it that it is. Monday Night Combat (better abbreviated as MNC) has been compared to the likes of Team Fortress 2 and Defense of the Ancients (DotA). The former, I don't really see, other than the fact that MNC uses classes. The latter seems like a more reasonable comparison.

MNC pits you in a tug-of-war-like battle where teams, supported by AI controlled minions, attempt to push into their opponent's base to destroy the central structure, the "Moneyball". The combat system is akin to an RPG-FPS in that you level up as you kill enemy minions, players, or turrets. Leveling up grants you the ability to upgrade any one of three skills unique to each of the six classes.

All the while this is going on, an announcer will be making snide and crude comments which not only adds character to the game, but hilarity. This is a colorful, competitive shooter one should definitely not miss out on!

Grade: B+

author: {'steamid': '76561197979084213', 'num_games_owned': 4492, 'num_reviews': 1009, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
A mix of tower defense and Team Fortress 2. It's actually quite polished... and fun ! The graphics look great and the game itself plays great as well. The maps are a bit small though and there are sometimes too many glass barriers. One other thing I didn't really like were the controls for the 3 powers each character has. They aren't mapped in a way that you can press them quickly without confusing yourself. I've had countless times where I pressed the wrong key. It's a fast paced game, and the buttons are color coded with a number, that's it. Yes, you can map the keys yourself, but you're missing the point. The developers chose this specific control scheme. But it just doesn't make any sense. I had rather seen buttons with the correct keys on them, or icons that show exactly what the buttons do. It's a small, but important thing. Still, if you love (ok, ok... - or like - your choice) team based third person shooters this might just be the game for you. Definately worth a few tries.

[quote]If you enjoyed this review please consider following me: [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41144728-markdj/]curator page[/url] [/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561197962115568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4562, 'last_played': 1312873200}
review: Monday Night Combat is a Multiplayer Third Person shooter with tower defense elements. Some people compare it to TF2 but other than some basic designs such as the class system I'd call that a lazy comparison. It plays and feels like an arena combat sports game where you are making a push towards the enemy money ball and with the help of your bots(creeps) you drop the shields and destroy it. The classes are a bit more hybridized that TF2. For instance there is a class that is like the medic and engy rolled together. You get to choose which stats to boost with money you earn through kills on bots and other players. You can also purchase and upgrade turret towers at fixed points in the map to slow the progress of the other team. It's a fun, cheap, sort of repatetive game that you can play when you want something a bit different. I'd recommend it but if you are looking for TF2 or some other shooter this one will feel different.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995697230', 'num_games_owned': 2621, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 86400}
review: It's easy to confuse this game as a TF2 clone considering the cartoon style of the characters, however, the gameplay is nothing like that multiplayer classic. Gone are the massive servers crowded with dozens of players, opting instead for a 6 vs. 6 game where teamwork goes far towards winning the match. Matches are fast-paced and you'll find yourself running through half a dozen matches in a single sitting pretty quickly. It's easy to learn the basics but with a reward system that allows you to customize your characters abilities the more time you put in, you'll find yourself coming back with a new player design every chance you can. I highly recommend this multiplayer experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010014422', 'num_games_owned': 3021, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 3409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3177, 'last_played': 1424662505}
review:
Monday Night Combat is one of the most fun competitive team games I've ever played.

It plays like a mash-up between TF2 (an FPS) and Dota (quasi-RTS), except not in either of those genres (3rd person shooter/action). Having been a long time fan of Dota, this is essentially that style of game in full 3D. So you'll be pushing bots, creeping enemy bots, and looking to kill enemy pros in order to get money and upgrade your skills.

The gameplay is frantic, strategical, and always a blast to play. But it's really the stylized characters and writing that help to make the experience so memorable. The gameplay is complimented by some hilarious dialogue that really brings the futuristc world of MNC to life. Think a parody of 1984 that's treated with just the right amount of humor and you'll get the picture. 

If you're on the fence about MNC, then do yourself a favor and buy it. The learning curve can be a little steep, but the game is always fun and rewarding.

review: MNC is another class-based, team-based multiplayer first person shooter.  However, the style of the game is comical and outlandish, far more so than TF2.  The  different classes are all very satisfying to use, and each has a unique close-quarters finishing move that is absolutely awesome.  The integration of the mechanical armies into the game really creates a unique and crazy experiene.  I highly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002790317', 'num_games_owned': 1027, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1689044614}
review: A third-person arcade style class based shooter. Each class has 4 basic perks which they can be upgraded to unleash havoc upon the opposing team. There are two game modes, Crossfire and Blitz. The objective of Crossfire is to destroy the opposing teams money ball while Blitz is a survival type game mode. A fun and fast-paced game that will entertain you for quite a while.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000625372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2856, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
The class-based gameplay of TF2 mixed with the special abilities of DotA, Monday Night Comat is a happy, colorful island in the midst of a gray ocean.  Yes, it costs money while TF2 doesn't, but the game is top-notch and the mechanics are extremely tight.

When you first start playing, you will play poorly and have no idea why.  Make a custom class as quickly as you can, because the default classes are simply not as good at surviving.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965676253', 'num_games_owned': 830, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 1364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1364, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
At first this seemed like a really interesting mesh between the Tower Defense and Class FPS genres. 
However it soon becomes just more of the same shadowed by the TF2 giant.

Right now it's pretty much dead considering the developers threw it into the garbage and released a freemium "sequel" with far more support. Tried the sequel for a bit but it still holds the same core problems. Just introducing new classes isn't enough if they're never truly engaging, which in a game like this is the big difference between staying or moving on forgetting the announcer voice, which was pretty much the only thing worth relating to...

author: {'steamid': '76561197993616755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 3384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3384, 'last_played': 86400}
review: This game straddles the line between TF2 (crazy, FPS mayhem!) and traditional CoD-style shooters (one player who knows how to move and how to aim can make all the difference). Can't aim? Play an engy and upgrade NPC towers for money. Great shot? Play a sniper and one-shot enemies. Either way, small teams and fun maps make each round action-packed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990903547', 'num_games_owned': 764, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1482, 'last_played': 1596038889}

author: {'steamid': '76561197975234919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 850, 'last_played': 1330243200}
review: Als je van Team Fortress 2 houd met een kleine tower defence elementje erin is dit zeker een spel die je wilt spelen. Niet veel maps maar dat is echt niet storend. 6 super vette classen te spelen met ieder hun eigen skills. Top spel

author: {'steamid': '76561198009550247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 86400}
review: When I first saw Monday Night Combat, I immediately scowled at it for looking like a blatant Team Fortress knock-off. Due to this, I shrugged it off for a while. Eventually it came to PC and I took interest in the popularity it was recieving. Sooner or later, I eventually got a copy and gave it a try. The similarities to TF2 are definitely there, but they're only a minor function in a whole 'nother machine. MNC combines class-based 3rd person shooting with strategic combat. Summoning bots and setting traps are just two of the many things that make it a unique multiplayer experience. Uber really got down the look and feel of a futuristic national past-time with a stadium, announcer and a story to explain two teams going at it. It's a great experience and really is it's own game in the end. I haven't been playing Monday Night Combat long, but already I love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986961257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1568, 'last_played': 1323763200}

author: {'steamid': '76561197983729636', 'num_games_owned': 3106, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1174, 'last_played': 1379019457}
review: I bought this game in a 4-pack for under $12, needless to say, it was well worth it. It takes elements from Team Fortress 2, League of Legends/Defense of the Ancients, Unreal Tournament and places it in one fast-paced team-oriented game. It's amazingly fun and quite addicting once you get the hang of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995320241', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 86400}

author: {'steamid': '76561197977764675', 'num_games_owned': 540, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1230, 'last_played': 1343113200}
review: For a class-based, third-person shooter, this game is actually very entertaining. To me, it's a much more fun alternative over Team Fortress 2. Aside from the obvious similarities, the differences are what make this game addicting. This is definitely one to grab up whenever it's on sale. I'm sure glad I did!

author: {'steamid': '76561198021779953', 'num_games_owned': 542, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 86400}
review: Игра короче на любителя ! Она подойдёт каким нибуть уёбкам , которым неначто тратить своё время ! Геймплей в игре хрень , просто тупая стрельба , то по роботам , то по игракам ! Графа типа ТФ2 ! Но карты , это самое ужасное в игре ! Карты в игре жутко однообразны , все они состоят только из железа , стекла и огоньков и всё ! Так , что очень не красиво получилось ! Игроков хрен различишь от роботов ! Вообщем если вы ценитель хороших игр , то не тратьтесь на эту х**ню ! И критике сильно завысили ей оценку ( 82/100 ) , я бы ваще 46 из 100 поставил !

author: {'steamid': '76561197993757686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 860, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 860, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
TF2 + DOTA. Each class has 2 weapons and about 3 action skills (one is melee). The objective of the game is to have the opposing team's "Cash Ball" destroyed, and only your AI bots can do that. So your purpose is to kill opposing players, enemy bots (some are weak, some are buff), and enemy turrets. Everytime you win a round, cash goes into your account which you can spend on purchasing a custom class setup with alternate perks (aka endorsements). The maps are also dynamic, you can invest in upgrading defense turrets (like tower defense), activating jump pods, and purchasing specific bots to attack.

Cons: The announcer is annoying as fuck, the music sucks, the feel and control of the game is consolish, Sniper class feels clunky, and there isn't a tutorial except for the Assault class.

If you want an alternative to TF2, get this on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978534278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 859, 'last_played': 1661308840}
review:
Great game, which combines Tower Defence with Team Fortress in the style that one would see in the old Quake 1 game.

The game is still in development, which causes some serious problems. That, along with terrible support from both the developers as Steam (which doesn't even list it in the troubleshooting section under 3rd party games) makes it a real pain if you want a simple LAN game with a buddy. Online gaming is generally available, if you can actually see any servers listed, which is not always the case.

Some serious bugs and problems that need to be addressed before they worry themselves with game balancing, but somehow, that is all they are concerned about...

P.S. If this looks like the kind of post one would expect on a forum or support site, I can't. My registration is still being processed (after a week of waiting) and I still can't get in touch with anybody that can actually solve any problems....

P.S.S. It is still a great concept and fun to play, if you can....

author: {'steamid': '76561197997590154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 710, 'last_played': 1325059200}
review:
[The game is dead now, don't buy it]

It may be a fun game, but I don't recommend buying it. According to the achievements, around 40% of the people who own the game can't run it or haven't even played a single round. Plus, the game's popularity dropped to nothing just two weeks after its release. I have 41 out of over 100 friends who own the game, and none have played the game in the last two weeks. Also, only one has played more than 50 hours.

I've yet to play more than two rounds of MNC myself, due to incompatibilities with my computer...I'd like to play, and if I could, I would play it occasionally, but that won't be happening anytime soon. :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198034275112', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
Come potrei non consigliare un videogioco del genere. Racchiude in pochi GB tutto quello che un giocatore di punta e clicca desidererebbe. Tutto si basa su un gioco "futuristico" chiamato -Monday Night Combat- che a primo impatto sembra proprio un'americanata, con fuochi d'artificio, mascotte e ragazze "comodino" il tutto miscelato con urla e incitazioni degli spettatori che tifano per la squadra rossa e per quella blu. Ci si trova davanti delle arene enormi e si deve riuscire a beccare la sfera avversaria. A dir poco "bellerrimo" come gioco include anche la possibilità di aumentare le caratteristiche del proprio pg e/o reinforzare le proprie difese con le monete trovate in gioco. Insomma dedicato a chi riesce a pensare velocemente e chi ha il dito preciso. Un bel gioco da PROVARE
(Voto personale 8.9)

review: MNC is a great game for those that don't like long rounds in games.  All you do in this game is escort bots to the enemies base and let them take their shields down. review: This is definitely above-average.  Distinct lack of shit-talking because everyone's usually busy playing, and DOTA is actually a lot of fun from a behind-the-back view.  Level design could be more interesting, but it's nice to see a multiplayer shooter go back to the "crowded arena" theme.  7/10, with room to grow on.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993194881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2562, 'last_played': 1328256000}
review:
Monday Night Combat is a really fun, intersting and challenging game. It is a lot like TF2 with the characters, though the characters have different skills that can be upgraded by attacking more players and earning money from kills.  You have a different variety of turrets, and you have bots that aid you in attacking the other side.

It requires team work and skill. Depending on who you have on the arena and who you have on your team, you need to strategise which best tactic to go about attacking the other side. Do you defend more and build turrets, or do you upgrade as fast as you can and attack the enemy base straight away. 

It is a fun game that is still a bit of a work in progress, but there is certainly more involved, has a few fun maps and the characters and their different skills, make it really really enjoyable to play. Would like to see more maps and different games in the future, but for now it is a lot of fun for such a cheap game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010702579', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 86400}
review: This is NOT TF2. Yeah, it looks like it. Yeah, it may act like it sometimes. But it is very different and very noteworthy. Price to fun ratio is very good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968617852', 'num_games_owned': 672, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1037, 'last_played': 1325059200}
review:
This game is simply great. Its a mix between TF2 + DotA(or LoL), but its in its own (and new) genre. Third-person classed based tower-defense shooter. The objective is simple, guide the bots into the enemy base so they can breach the sheilds of the moneball, only they can breach it. Bots spawn at a constant rate.  After that you lay waste to it, but watch out for the base turrets! Five classes, each one can be upgraded with 4 skills, which cost money. Money is simply earned from killing or picking up the coins on the ground. One main downside is few maps.

- 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197981939207', 'num_games_owned': 1952, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2195, 'last_played': 1396578164}

author: {'steamid': '76561197961629089', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1815, 'last_played': 1456994604}
review:
Despite the graphical style that makes everyone assume this is just a TF2 clone, it doesn't have very many similarities to TF2.  The only similarities are the graphic style, being class based, and being multiplayer.  The actual gameplay involves teams guiding their bots to the other team's base to bring the shield down on their moneyball while preventing the same from happening to them while the classes are a bit different than those in TF2 and is thrown together in a package that is quite fun.

Some may have issues with the announcer's voice going on all the time or the pit girls that are part of the loading screens, but I haven't found either to be that big of a deal really.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963979564', 'num_games_owned': 390, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 14768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14703, 'last_played': 1448146898}
review:
You owe it to yourself to buy this game.  You get a free weekend this weekend and it's 33% off if you decide to buy it ... which you should.  I think people are turned off because the graphics are close to TF2 so they assume that the game is just a rip off but the gameplay is COMPLETELY different.  This is not a deathmatch game.  Think 3rd person DotA and you've got it.  I think people get discouraged by the game because they don't understand it but once you finally get the hang of what's going on it's hard to put down.
The developer is making constant updates to the game and are showing real dedication to making it the best game possible.
This game is well $50 but you can own it for $10.  Seriously, you have no reason not to try it

author: {'steamid': '76561197975854209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 5570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5570, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
Monday Night Combat is the fastest paced shooter I have played. If you like a shooter with some surprisingly interesting map strategies and a true test of your reflexes then this one is worth a try. The atmosphere of future deathsport is a real selling-point for this game. Basic gameplay involves escorting groups of bots to the enemy's base while preventing the enemy from doing the same. Variant maps change up this formula to some degree.

There is a single-player and multiplayer co-op mode against bots as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034188894', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
TF2をよりスポーツゲーにしたような感じ、オンは対戦の他にKFのようなサバイバルモードもあるのでCO-OP好きな方には特に勧めたい一品
もとが箱のゲームを輸入したのでサーバブラウザとかその辺は不便に思うところはありますがゲーム性はなかなか頭使います。
このゲームをあらわす言葉があるなら「対戦版タワーディフェンス」といったところでしょうか、BOTを敵に送り込み、タレットガンを設置し自陣を守り時に自分が他プレイヤーが相手を陥れる、派手なアクションがない分万人にとっつきやすいでしょう。
ただ一つ欠点があるなら、”ルールが把握しずらい！”

author: {'steamid': '76561197995352397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 998, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 998, 'last_played': 86400}
review: Schon lustig gemacht ist ein gutes Spiel für zwischendruch :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197993155325', 'num_games_owned': 510, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1318057200}
review: MNC is often compared to TF2; this is a inaccurate comparison.  While both are class-based team shooters with a lot of zaniness, that's about where the similarities end.  MNC is more a fusion of "tower defense" gameplay with a third-person shooter, as your team defends its "money ball" against attacks from both robot and human enemies using your own robots, turrets, and weapons ranging from traditional assault rifles to dual miniguns to jet engine guns.  Basically, if you like TF2, you'll probably like MNC, but don't expect the same old gameplay.  Definitely worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021204633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1307343600}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999111677', 'num_games_owned': 948, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 2079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2079, 'last_played': 1313650800}
review:
It's like DotA (Defense of the Ancients) meets Team Fortress 2, on drugs! (Performance enhancing drugs, mind you!)

This is the first and only third-person-shooter tower defense game in existence. (As of this writing) If you like tower defenses, third person shooters, team fortress 2, or MOBAs (Multiplayer Online Battle Arenas), then I highly recommend this game to youl (Some mentionable MOBAs for those of you not sure what they are include, DotA, League of Legends, Heroes of Newerth, or Aeon of Strife.)

Go buy this game now!

author: {'steamid': '76561197981449590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1488, 'last_played': 86400}
review: Where DotA meets TF2.  Class based action in which you gain money for killing NPC bots, players, and turrets.  You then use that money to upgrade your skills, purchase turrets for your base defense, or spawn specialized bots to attack the enemy players.  Very fun and well worth $15.

review: This game is fuggin awesome. It's kind of a cross between TF2 and DOTA. The rounds are like 10 -15 minute matches with a possible overtime (some friends of mine are very opposed to the overtime feature, however I personally don't mind it as I feel that it brings a quick closure to each game) The classes seemed pretty balanced and it truly depends on player ability as opposed to a player level system or an ultimate character build. (although there is some customization that can be done but I feel thats pretty minimal)

review: Very fun, very frantic. A game of fast-paced revenge and vendettas in a quick, colorful shooter. If you aren't challenged, switch servers. I've been able to have a real game with this one! Amazing for the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986510429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 4755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4755, 'last_played': 1324540800}
review:
An absolutely fantastic 3rd person multiplayer shooter. Basically, it plays like Team Fortress 2, with it's mix of classes, combined with DoTA. You have bots which you must escort to the opposing team's base to destroy their Moneyball. You also have turrets to defend you Moneyball from the other team's atttack. This gives the game quite a frantic pace as you try to kill other players, kill bots and destroy turrents along with defending your own base.

The game has a fairly large learning curve, in that you'll need to spend some time learning one particular class to get into it. It's a little harsher than TF2 - probably because there are only 6 peeps per team in this game so can't be propped up as much by your teammates. Better players will also dominate you to begin with. Don't worry. Your K/D  ratio means nothing and you'll get there eventually.

Once you're past the curve it's a really fun MP game. There are still some issues with Blitz - the co-op mode. Hopefully that's fixed soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989210208', 'num_games_owned': 1661, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6329, 'last_played': 1482286727}
review:
Monday Night Combat is a third person shooter set in the future, where you play one of 6 different types of clones in a sporting setting (If you already didn't know that).
The objective is not unlike DOTA - Push your bots to the enemy base and kill the bots coming to yours. 

It is very clear to see that alot of work has been put into this game - Uber Entertainment have gone all out with the theme. There is a proper commentary announcer present, the levels are HUGE stadiums and there are passive 'skills' known as Endorsements which are provided by 24 different sponsers.

However, I feel as if the marketing people pushed this game into the world too early. There are alot of bugs, both gameplay wise and hardware/software specific.  I had to jump through hoops to even launch the game, then more to play it, only to be annoyed by more bugs in game.

Do not buy this game unless you are prepared to play a Beta - I fail to see how this game even left Beta status in the first place.

review:
그래픽 깔끔하고 개그코드도 있고

클래스랑 추가장비 정도만 고를 수 있고 무기 커스텀 같은게 없음.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968135190', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
Let's do this tiki style!

Are you a fan of Defense of the Ancients, or perhaps League of Legends or Heroes of Newerth?  Do you enjoy the team-based action that comes with Team Fortress and its spin-offs and sequels?  Then, my friend...  This game is for you!  All the driving, level-based action of Defense of the Ancients combined with the team-based fast-action combat of Team Fortress is exactly what you get with Monday Night Combat!  And if that's not enough of a reason to buy this game, here's another one: You can shoot the game's mascot.  And you are RICHLY rewarded for doing so!  What other game has THAT?

Monday Night Combat.  It's silly.  It's violent.  It's awesome.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010201914', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 3318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3318, 'last_played': 1336374000}
review: Great team-based strategy/action game!  I would describe it as Team Fortress 2 style gameplay and graphics combined with the strategy and teamwork necessary in League of Legends.  Class diversity and working together are essential to win, as each map is split into several "lanes" where your team's robots (as well as the other team's on their side) spawn, and have a specific route they go depending on their lane.  Your job is to clear the way, while watching out for enemy "Pro" players (the classes are called "Pros") and killing them if necessary, which it usually is.  But don't be fooled, this game is not all about racking up the kills!  You will want to lead the robots to the opposing team's "Money Ball," which can be considered the home base of their base, and have them attack it while you help.  The robots bring down the Money Ball's protective shield, but watch out for Turrets throughout the base!  If you find serious players who work together and talk, this game is VERY addicting!

review:
[h1]What is Monday Night Combat?[/h1]
[b]Heavily inspired by Team Fortress 2 and Class Based Shooters, Monday Night Combat aims to give you a new experience with a Third-Person Arena Shooter inspired by TF2.

Monday Night Combat is a very fun Team Fortress 2 inspired arena shooter. You pick a character much like Team Fortress and just blast way with your friends or randoms and just have fun. 

At this time, sadly, Super Monday Night Combat is shut down, but you can play the original

I very much recommend the game despite the lack of players as its one of the most unique Arena shooters out there, give it a try if you can.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197983806719', 'num_games_owned': 657, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 823, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
In a hellish future where man seems to be ruled by an unseen overlord who uses semi-sentient machines to violate the populace in ways that can only be described as "nightmarishly deprived of mercy" there exists sport. It would seem to be humanities only given right (other than that of working and that of spending what little money they have on useless trinkets that they helped create, the brain washed whores of the world do this happily.) and it happens once a week, genetics taken from the heros of the past are used to create meat sacks with no reason to live but to experience pain and die. They are bet on by the crowd and thrown into an enclosed arena, forced to fight one another as well machine drones of no sentience programmed for one simple task. The lives of these so called 'pros' are short and filled with nothing but grief and rage.


It is a hellish future, it mirrors our own.


8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197966082345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 4522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4522, 'last_played': 86400}
review: Monday Night Combat é uma mistura de DOTA com Team Fortress 2, de forma que o jogo apresenta algo novo e divertido. Escolha entre 6 classes diferentes, com habilidades customizáveis e evolução in-game que se assemelha ao DOTA, e entre em diversas arenas com o objetivo de destruir o “moneyball” do time rival, ou mesmo juntar 4 amigos para defender seu “moneyball” de waves constantes de inimigos. Apesar do lag alto, o jogo não fica tão travado quanto parece, é “jogável” e bastante divertido para um jogo de team play. Uma boa opção para quem curte jogos do gênero de TF2, mas bem mais dinâmico.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991200866', 'num_games_owned': 367, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 841, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
MNC's a fun game, mate! It's challengin' work, inside 'renas. I guarantee you'll not get bored. Cause at the end of the round, long as there's two people left on the field, someone is gonna get someone dead!
Balance? Look mate, you know what games has a lot of balance?
Boring ones that bludgeon their fun to death with a nerfhammer. 

Fun games have standards! 

Do some grabs. 
Throw some bombs.
Have a plan to kill every robot you meet!

Nonstop action 3rdPS in a futuristic enviroment, for a measly ~10 bucks. This game gives plenty more hours of play time than a 49.99 one.

Replayability: 4/5
Balance: 3/5
Graphics: 3/5
Price for what you get: 5/5

Total score: 4/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198020838925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 912, 'last_played': 1312873200}
review:
Let me start off by saying, despite what you may have heard, Monday Night Combat is NOT a Team Fortress 2 rip-off.

Monday Night Combat is a fun little tower defense game, normally a genre I despise but this makes it fun.
You have three game modes: Single-player, Blitz which is a co-op version of Single-player, and Crossfire where the Hotshot and Ice Man teams fight to destroy the other's moneyball while defending their own.

You have six classes to choose from, I was gonna describe them but I hit the character limit AGAIN.

Play the game.
I hit the character limit TWICE writing this, that should tell you enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999112790', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 86400}
review: Totally worth the 15 bucks, another great game worth much more than its price like TF2. The classed based push game style is very fun, with 6 classes pushing "bots" to destroy the enemy's base. The aspects of dota + TF2 and the unique art style make for a great enviroment arena to fight in. Not to mention i got a few hats in TF2 for this. Its all about the multiplayer, and i love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009288616', 'num_games_owned': 795, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 644, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
Surprisingly fun for a $15 game; It's got 6 classes, and games mostly operate as a mixture of Tower Defence, Unreal Tournament 3, and Team Fortress 2.

Singleplayer consists of just tower defensing, whereas multiplayer splits 12 players into 2 teams of 6, each with a "tower" to defend, and unlimited bots. Each team can build towers or buy more bots. Sadly, hardly anyone is playing the co-op portion of the game (there was maybe 12 local servers, with half being passworded last I checked). Co-op is the same gametypes as singleplayer (tower defense with x number of waves, or unlimited waves).

Some parts of the game seem a bit unbalanced perhaps, but they don't subtract from the overall experience; my biggest complaint is that there is only about 4 multiplayer maps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012660943', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1510, 'last_played': 86400}

author: {'steamid': '76561197997575027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5264, 'last_played': 1320825600}
review:
Monday Night Combat ("MNC") muses over the savage events that once took place in the ancient Colosseum, notably gladiatorial combat and the slaying of exotic beasts. MNC draws parallels to these events now alien to modern humans tamed with the domesticated and subdued format of what we now call "sports." In MNC, the combatants are not only supposed to mutilate one another, but also unautonomous "bots" on their way to glory. 

In the background is the audience; in the most literal sense of what Guy Debord calls "the spectacle," we see the audience of MNC as mere shadows, replaced and defined instead by their fetish for the merciless spectacle of the arena. The overwhelming mass media advertising (so called "endorsements") of this future time reveals the financial underpinning and true consumerist nature of the event. 

MNC is a herald of a generation to come; warning of the lenghts to which rampant consumerism will go to ensure a profit.  In the world of MNC, the message is untimely.

review:
This game is basically Team Fortress and DotA combined. Escort bots to the enemy base, kill enemy bots and players to make money, use money to upgrade. Every class has a different role, and some classes hard-counter others.

Weapons have tons of different uses too. The game's surprisingly deep for what it looks like. Only problem is that the Rocket Turrets take waaaaay too much abuse unless you're juiced. Otherwise everything's awesome.

completely worth the 15 dollars

author: {'steamid': '76561197970765040', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1330, 'last_played': 1321603200}
review:
Monday Night Combat is possibly the best example of western consumerism you'll ever see. After all, who else would knock down the Great Pyramids because they'd "gone out of style"?

Monday Night Combat pits two teams (The Hotshots and the Icemen, who are Orange and Blue respectively) against each other in a battle to look cool as fuck. 6 different Pros are selectable, ranging from the executively cool Assault, who advises you to step aside due to his large step-taking, to the mentally deranged Sniper, who will more than likely want an official review on every kill that isn't his. Also in the playing leagues are bots, ranging from the Slim, a small, easy to destroy robot, to the Bouncer, a heavy, gorrila like bot that will easily turn Pros into Mash. Also on the playing field after being banned for 10 seasons is the JACKBOT XL, a heavy robot that only wants a cuddle but ends up killing those he attempts to cuddle.

Please note: Not restricted to Monday.

review: My new favourite third person shooter. The 6v6 versus mode is not some generic team deathmatch, it includes defending your base with sentry guns then spawning and guiding AI robots to attack your enemies base for a start. Has a nice little co-op mode too where you defend against swarms of the robots in waves. The classes are well balanced and the game has a sponsorship system to slightly tweak your characters without going over the top. Stats, tags, money and leaderboards are all nice touches that may leave me spending a silly amount of time on this fun little game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994076733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1410, 'last_played': 1334905200}
review: in my opinion, well worth the price. there is a severe lack of servers at the moment, but when this game gets more popular, that wont be an issue. the gameplay as fairly fast paced, depending on the class you pick. the mechanics should be vaguely familiar to anyone with knowledge of the DOTA games, as it is basically DOTA but in 3rd person shooter mode. you start each match with the most basic skills, and you gain money which you use to buy turrets, upgrade your skills, or many other things. overall, a fun game to play, especially with friends. i should know, i just stayed up all night with JimmyC playing this game until 6 am.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974897765', 'num_games_owned': 1475, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 942, 'last_played': 86400}

author: {'steamid': '76561197967801082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 6975, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6975, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
Monday Night Combat is a 3rd-person shooter, whose objective is to destory the other team's moneyball with small arms fire. The catch is, however, that you can't destroy its initial shields yourself - AI controlled bots for your team must do that. Thus, you must escort them, destroy enemy bots, and let them bring down the shield so that your human players can finish the job.

In practice, this game focuses less on racking up kills and soloing objectives (a near-impossible task), and requires teamwork and killing AI bots more than other players, which results in rewarding kills and less frustration for players who often have trouble staying alive.

All the classes have their niche, and it is actually quite difficult to be a liability to your team. Even if you can't kill other players or stay alive for long, you can contribute greatly by stopping the advance of enemy teams' bots. This alone, in my opinion, makes the game a lot less frustrating than team-based shooters usually are.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961204640', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2351, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
A fun, very addicting game. Each of the six classes has 4 awesome perks which make all of them very powerful in their own ways. Max out your perk levels, then buy turrets to help defend from or destroy the other teams. If you have spare cash, you can even buy your class's own specialty bot and have it help you exterminate other players. 

Worth what little money it costs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990877742', 'num_games_owned': 553, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 86400}
review: It's like Global Agenda, just with less QQ and more Pew-Pew.  Also has similar classes to TF2.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993275299', 'num_games_owned': 1975, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
So Monday Night Combat (which, according to Bullseye [MNC official mascot] "it's da best") is a great game. It's basically like DotA, tower defense and TF2 class based action mixed together. Review done. Ship it.

This game is not TF2. The only thing it really shares is the classes, but Uber Ent was able to advert the game being TF2, the characters are original enough and the class base traits and roles are unique (in a nutshell, having classes is like the only thing the game shares with TF2).

MNC is one of my favorite Xbox games, and now that it is on the PC, I'm estatic. The content provided on the PC exceeds the Xbox version. And with a high replay factor, there really isn't much to lose.

Verdict: BUY

author: {'steamid': '76561197975441091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 8323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8323, 'last_played': 1327305600}
review:
Гладиаторские бои для потехи плебса будущего. Неоновые рекламки, декорированные кровякой и приваренными запчастями только что расплавленных рейлганом роботов, динамика и разноплановость сетевых баталий приправленная обаянием персонажей-классов ни в чём не цитирующих оных из TF2. 

+ Ассасин, девушка востока. Возможно трёхглазая :D

author: {'steamid': '76561197992390323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 86400}
review: Lorsque vous mélangez Team Fortress 2 pour les classes, le fun et l'humour, avec DotA pour le systeme de level/skill des personnages, pour jouer avec des creep/bot essayant d'atteindre les objectifs, et que vous faisiez en sorte que ce soit à la 3e personnes, vous obtenez MNC l'un des jeux les plus sympas à jouer!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996817899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 211834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 344, 'playtime_at_review': 125621, 'last_played': 1710631044}
review:
This game is a ton of fun.
It's set in a gameshow in the future where you play as a contestent (one of 6 classes --> Sniper, Support, Tank, Gunner, Assault, Assassin).  There are 2 modes crossfire (PvP) and Blitz (Co-op).  Crossfire is the mode that I play the most.  Basically it's a 6 on 6 arena where your goal is to get your team's bots past the enemy's turrets in order to take down their moneyball.  Once the moneyball's shields are down, you can attack it.  Lots of strategy is involved though due to the varying skills that each of the classes come armed with.  You'll need to take out enemy players, enemy bots and enemy turrets before you can get your bots in.  There are environmental hazards you can use to your advantage, you can upgrade yourself in-game, you can buy/upgrade turrets, and you can even purchase additional bots to come help you out.

I highly recommend this game, but do be forewarned that the player-base is currently pretty small.
10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197996240993', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
MNC, un jeu amusant. On remarque tout de suite une très légère ressemblance avec TF2... Surtout au niveau des classes de personnages à jouer.
Malgré un déséquilibre de puissance de ces classes (à mon goùt), qui peut parfois ruiner la partie, le jeu est sympathique, les graphismes simples nous rappellent que le gameplay prime, et ce n'est pas pour nous déplaire !
Le mode multi est bien foutu, l'argent, principal moteur du jeu en multi, permet l'achat de titre (tiens tiens ça me rappelle un certain jeu), n'est pas trop difficile à avoir, on tourne en moyenne avec 2000 dollars par partie si celle-ci est équilibrée.

MNC s'inspire, mais reste un jeu intéréssant. De plus, son prix est raisonnable.
Lachez-vous !

author: {'steamid': '76561197970690368', 'num_games_owned': 8511, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 86400}
review: It may bear a resemblance to Team Fortress 2 at first glance, but it's really not all that similar. It is class based and has a similar art style, but that's about it. Monday Night Combat is really a hybrid between a third-person shooter and a tower defense game, and the mix works very well. It has an exaggerated TV sports presentation that is equal parts cool and hilarious, and leaves me fondly comparing it to Smash TV. Most importantly, it's a lot of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960776515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
It's not a Team Fortress 2 clone as a lot of people think.

It's a fun arena based third person shooter with a Coop mode against bots.

If you want to think about similar games, maybe if Unreal Tournament (back when it was a future contest) and Team Fortress 2 had a baby, it would be Monday Night Combat but with a 3rd person twist.
